definition: Laziness refers to a tendency to avoid activity or exertion, often associated with idleness and a lack of motivation. It's a state of inactivity or reluctance to work or use energy.
example: John didn't want to mow the lawn because he was feeling quite lazy that day.

definition: Lazy refers to a lack of energy or effort, often used to describe someone who avoids work or exertion.
example: John was too lazy to clean his room, so he left it in a mess.

definition: To lead means to go ahead of others and show the way, or to guide and direct. It can also refer to a position of authority or a material used in construction.
example: The explorer led his team through the dense jungle following the map he had prepared.

definition: A leader is an individual who guides, directs, or inspires a group, organization, or movement. They often set goals, develop strategies to achieve those goals, and motivate others towards their realization.
example: "Martin Luther King Jr. was a great leader during the civil rights movement in America, inspiring millions of people to fight for equality and justice."

definition: Leadership refers to the ability of an individual or a group to guide, inspire, and influence others towards achieving a common goal or vision.
example: The teacher exhibited strong leadership skills by motivating her students to excel in their studies and organizing collaborative projects that fostered teamwork and creativity.

definition: To lead is to guide or direct, to show the way, typically implying taking a position of authority. It can also refer to being ahead in terms of position, quality, or quantity.
example: The teacher was leading the class through a new and complex math problem. John was the leading scorer on the basketball team.

definition: A leaf is a flat, expanded outgrowth from the stem of a plant, typically green in color and specialized for photosynthesis.
example: The leaves on the tree are turning red and golden as autumn approaches.

definition: A small sheet of printed matter, typically folded into several layers, used to carry information or advertisements.
example: She handed out leaflets about the charity event during the festival.

definition: A league is a group of sports teams or countries that compete in organized competitions.
example: "Manchester City and Liverpool are both part of the English Premier League, England's top-tier football (soccer) competition."

definition: A leak is the uncontrolled flow of fluid or gas from a container, pipe, or other enclosed space. It often refers to an unwanted escape of information or secret.
example: The whistleblower leaked documents about the company's illegal activities to the media. (Information leak)

definition: To be inclined or slant in a particular direction; to have little or no excess flesh on one's body. Also, to make (something) operate more efficiently by removing wasteful practices or unnecessary expenses.
example: He decided to lean toward a more minimalist lifestyle in order to save money.

definition: To jump or move with a bound, especially through the air. It can also refer to making a sudden advance or progress in a particular activity or subject.
example: The deer leapt gracefully over the stream.

definition: To acquire knowledge or skill through experience, study, or teaching.
example: John learns Spanish by taking classes and practicing with native speakers.

definition: A learner is an individual who acquires knowledge, skills, or abilities through studying, training, or experiencing events. They are open to gaining new information and improving their understanding.
example: The student enrolled in the language course was a diligent learner, eager to master the complex grammar rules.

definition: The act or process of acquiring new knowledge, skills, or behaviors through experience, study, or instruction. It often involves changes in long-term memory.
example: Jane is spending her summer break learning Spanish by taking online lessons and practicing with native speakers.

definition: A lease is a contract between a lessor (property owner) and a lessee (renter), which grants the lessee the right to use or occupy the property for a specified period of time in exchange for regular rent payments.
example: John signed a two-year lease for an apartment last month, paying $1200 per month as rent.

definition: A leash is a flexible rope, chain, or cord used to control an animal, especially dogs, by connecting it to its collar.
example: The dog was pulling on the leash as we walked towards the park.

definition: The least refers to the smallest or minimum quantity, amount, degree, or number in a comparison. It is used to indicate the position at the end of an ordered set.
example: Among all the students, John scored the least marks in the test.

definition: Leather is a durable, flexible material made from processed animal hides or skins. It is often used for making clothing, footwear, furniture, and other items that require a tough, long-lasting material.
example: She wore a beautiful leather jacket on her motorcycle ride through the mountains.

definition: To go away from a place or to cause someone to go away, usually temporarily. It can also mean to stop doing something.
example: The teacher asked the students to leave their phones in their lockers during the test. (In this case, "leave" means "stop using something temporarily.")

definition: A lecture is an educational discourse delivered by a teacher or expert on a specific topic to a group of students, typically in an academic setting. It is designed to inform and instruct the audience about a particular subject matter.
example: The professor gave a two-hour lecture on the history of modern art in Europe during the 20th century.

definition: A lecturer is an academic staff member at a university or college who delivers presentations or instructional talks to students on specific subjects.
example: "The history lecturer gave an engaging lecture about the fall of the Roman Empire, captivating the audience with visual aids and lively discussions."

definition: Leeks are long, slender vegetables that belong to the Allium (onion) family. They have a mild onion-like flavor and are often used in soups, stews, and as a seasoning in many dishes.
example: In this hearty potato and leek soup, sliced leeks are sautÃ©ed with butter until soft before being combined with potatoes, broth, and cream. The soup is then simmered until the vegetables are tender, making for a comforting and flavorful meal.

definition: The term "left" is primarily used to describe a direction, being the opposite of right. It can also refer to being absent or departed from a place. In a political context, it often refers to progressive or liberal ideologies.
example: In the political arena, many advocates for social justice identify as being on the left. (Political context)

definition: The left-hand refers to the non-dominant hand when using tools, writing, or playing a musical instrument. It is typically associated with the side of the body that is closest to the heart when standing facing the front.
example: "When learning to play the guitar, I found it challenging to switch my right hand between chords and strumming while using my left hand for fretting the notes."

definition: A leg is a long, usually columnar limb of an animal, used for locomotion and support. It typically consists of the thigh, shin, and foot regions.
example: The dog wagged its tail and stretched out its front legs as it waited patiently by the door.

definition: Legal refers to something that is in accordance with the law, officially sanctioned, or having a valid claim or title.
example: The contract was legal because it was written according to the signed agreement and all relevant laws.

definition: According to the law or regulations; authorized, permitted, or validated by a court of law or by statute.
example: "The contract is legally binding, as it was signed in front of a notary public."

definition: A legend is a well-known story, especially one popularly regarded as being based on truth but not capable of being proved or disproved.
example: The tales of Robin Hood are considered legends in English folklore.

definition: Legendary refers to something or someone that is widely known and admired for greatness or remarkable achievements. It often implies a status of being exceptional, historical, or iconic.
example: Michael Jordan is considered a legendary basketball player due to his numerous accomplishments on the court.

definition: To make or enact laws, especially as a legislative body. It involves creating, passing, and implementing rules that govern behavior within a particular jurisdiction.
example: The Senate has voted to legislate a new bill that aims to reduce carbon emissions in the country.

definition: Legislation refers to laws, rules, or acts that are established by a government body or legislature. These legal instruments regulate behavior, outline penalties for violations, and set the framework for society's functioning.
example: The new legislation on data privacy requires all businesses to obtain explicit consent from their customers before collecting any personal information.

definition: Legislative refers to the branch of government that makes, enacts, or passes laws. It involves the creation and alteration of existing statutes, regulations, and ordinances.
example: The legislative body of the United States is the U.S. Congress, which consists of the Senate and the House of Representatives. They work together to pass bills that become laws in the country.

definition: A legislator is an individual who makes or enacts laws within a political system, typically as a member of a legislative assembly.
example: As a legislator in the House of Representatives, Congresswoman Johnson sponsored a bill aimed at reducing carbon emissions nationwide.

definition: Legislature refers to a governing body with the power to make laws within a political entity, such as a government. It is typically composed of elected representatives who collectively deliberate and vote on proposed legislation.
example: The members of the legislature are currently debating a bill regarding climate change policy in their country's capital.

definition: Legitimate means something is legal, valid, or authorized. It can also refer to something that is authentic or genuine.
example: The election results were legitimate because they followed all the established rules and procedures.

definition: Leisure refers to free time or recreational activities that are undertaken for pleasure rather than a necessary duty. It is about enjoying oneself and relaxing.
example: After a long week at work, John decided to spend his leisure on hiking in the nearby forest, hoping to see some rare wildlife.

definition: Leisurely refers to moving or acting at a slow, relaxed pace; without haste. It describes an activity enjoyed for pleasure rather than work or necessity.
example: After finishing her shift, she decided to have a leisurely stroll along the beach, enjoying the sunset and the sound of the waves.

definition: Lemon is a citrus fruit with a sour taste, characterized by its yellow rind and juicy interior. It's often used in culinary applications, as a refreshing beverage, or for cleaning due to its acidity.
example: I squeezed some lemon juice into my water for a refreshing drink on a hot day.

definition: Lemonade is a sweet, tart beverage made primarily from lemon juice, water, and sugar. It may also contain other ingredients like mint or ginger.
example: She bought a refreshing glass of homemade lemonade at the summer fair.

definition: To provide something (such as money, an object, or skill) to someone temporarily with the expectation that it will be returned.
example: John lent his car to his friend for the weekend while he was on vacation.

definition: Length is a measurement of how far one end of an object or space extends to the other end, usually expressed in units such as meters (m), feet (ft), inches (in), etc.
example: The length of this table is about two meters.

definition: To make something longer in size, duration, or length of time.
example: I need to lengthen the straps on my shoes as they have become too short.

definition: Characterized by being long in duration or extent.
example: The meeting was lengthy, lasting for three hours instead of the scheduled two.

definition: A leopard is a large, agile big cat with a variable coat of fur having open spots called rosettes. It is native to most of Africa and parts of Asia.
example: The majestic leopard prowled silently through the tall grasslands of the African savanna.

definition: Less means smaller in number, amount, degree, or importance. It can also indicate a reduction or diminishment.
example: She needs less sugar in her coffee now that she's diabetic.

definition: To make smaller or reduce in degree, quantity, severity, or number.
example: The use of preventive measures can lessen the chances of a heart attack.

definition: A lesson is an educational exercise or experience designed to teach someone something new, usually in a systematic and structured manner.
example: The math teacher gave the class a lesson on fractions.

definition: "Lest" is a conjunction used to express fear or apprehension of a possible, often negative, consequence. It is commonly followed by the subjunctive form of the verb.
example: "I will call you tonight, lest I forget." (Meaning: I might forget if I don't call you tonight.)

definition: To allow or enable something to happen, give permission, or provide an opportunity. It can also serve as a verb auxiliary used to form the passive voice.
example: "She lets her dog out every morning at 6 am." or "The ball was let go by the pitcher." (in the passive voice)

definition: A letter is a written or printed communication sent from one person to another, often enclosed in an envelope and delivered by mail. It typically consists of text, possibly with drawings or diagrams, and may be formal or informal in nature.
example: Jane wrote a heartfelt letter to her grandmother expressing her love and gratitude for all the years they spent together.

definition: Lettuce is a leafy green or purple vegetable that is commonly used in salads and sandwiches. It has soft, crisp leaves that can grow in a head or loose rosette form.
example: In the salad, there were tomatoes, cucumbers, bell peppers, carrots, and lettuce.

definition: Level refers to a flat or horizontal surface, or an extent or degree on which something is measured or compared. It can also mean a stage or standard of proficiency or skill.
example: The students are all at the same level in this math class. (Proficiency/skill)

definition: A person who intentionally and knowingly speaks falsehoods or makes untruthful statements.
example: "John is a liar because he repeatedly claims to have finished his homework when in reality, he hasn't."

definition: Liberal refers to someone who holds and promotes social and political views that support individual freedoms, equal rights, and a role for the government in regulating business and providing a safety net for its citizens. This is often associated with being open-minded and tolerant towards others.
example: "John is a liberal who advocates for affordable healthcare, environmental protection, and social justice."

definition: To free or release from captivity, confinement, or control.
example: The troops were ordered to liberate the city from enemy occupation.

definition: The act or process of setting someone or something free from imprisonment, captivity, slavery, oppression, or control. It often implies the removal of restrictions on freedom or independence.
example: The soldiers celebrated the liberation of their city from enemy occupation after a long and arduous battle.

definition: Liberty is the state of being free within society from oppressive restrictions imposed by authority on one's way of life, behavior, or political views.
example: John felt a great sense of liberty when he graduated and was finally able to make his own choices about his career and lifestyle.

definition: A librarian is a professional who organizes, manages, and maintains libraries and their collections, assists patrons in finding information and using library resources.
example: The school's librarian helped the students find accurate sources for their research project on global warming.

definition: A library is a place where books, other media, and sometimes digital or multimedia resources are collected, organized, and made available for use and reference by the public.
example: "I visited the local library to borrow some books about ancient civilizations for my research project."

definition: A license is a formal permission granted by a party (usually an organization or government) that allows another party to undertake specific activities, often related to the use of copyrighted material, proprietary technology, or public resources.
example: You need a driver's license to legally operate a motor vehicle on public roads.

definition: To touch with the tongue, especially in order to taste something. Also, to move one's tongue quickly over a surface to clean it or show affection.
example: The dog licked the spoon to get the last bit of peanut butter.

definition: A lid is a cover used to close and protect containers or objects, often with a hinged design.
example: I forgot to put the lid on the coffee pot before leaving for work this morning.

definition: A lie is a false statement deliberately presented as truth. It's typically told to deceive or manipulate someone else.
example: "I didn't eat the last cookie," said John, but he actually did and was trying to keep it for himself.

definition: Life is the condition that distinguishes animals and plants from inanimate objects and dead organisms, characterized by growth, reproduction, responsiveness, and metabolism. It is a natural phenomenon that requires energy to maintain its essential activities.
example: She spent her entire life caring for orphaned animals at the local wildlife sanctuary.

definition: A lifeguard is a person trained in water safety, first aid, and rescue techniques who watches over a specific area of a pool, beach, or other body of water to prevent accidents and provide assistance to swimmers if needed.
example: The lifeguard on duty blew her whistle as she saw the struggling swimmer far out in the ocean. She swam quickly towards him, ready to perform a rescue.

definition: Lifeless refers to something that lacks life or vitality, or is devoid of animation or activity. It can also mean uninteresting or dull.
example: The planet seemed lifeless with no signs of vegetation or movement.

definition: Relating to or lasting throughout one's entire lifetime.
example: She has been a passionate reader her whole life, and her lifelong dream is to write a novel.

definition: The habits, interests, and behaviors that collectively comprise one's way of living. This can include things like diet, leisure activities, social habits, and values.
example: John has a healthy lifestyle, he exercises regularly, eats nutritious food, and gets enough sleep every night.

definition: Lifetime refers to the entire span of an individual's life, from birth to death. It can also be used more generally to describe the duration over which something exists or functions.
example: The warranty on this product is valid for a lifetime, so it will be replaced free of charge if it breaks during your entire ownership.

definition: To lift means to raise something or someone from a lower place or position, often by using physical effort. It can also refer to a mechanical device used for raising objects, such as an elevator.
example: John lifted the heavy box off the floor and placed it on the table. In this example, John is physically lifting the box from the floor to a higher position (the table).

definition: Light is electromagnetic radiation that can be detected by the human eye, and it has different wavelengths that produce colors ranging from red to violet. It allows us to see objects, and it travels at a speed of approximately 299,792 kilometers per second in a vacuum.
example: The sun emits a bright light during the daytime, illuminating everything on Earth.

definition: To make lighter or less dense, or to become less heavy. Also, to make something less serious, intense, or burdensome; to alleviate.
example: After eating a large meal, I felt my spirits lighten when I went for a walk outside.

definition: A device that uses heat, sparks, or a battery to ignite fire quickly and easily.
example: I always carry a lighter in my pocket for lighting cigarettes.

definition: Lighting refers to the man-made or natural illumination of an environment, typically using electric lamps. It is used to make objects or areas visible and can significantly impact the mood and ambiance of a space.
example: "The dim lighting in the restaurant created a romantic atmosphere for dinner."

definition: Lightly refers to performing an action or applying force in a gentle, not forceful manner. It can also mean something that is not heavy or dense.
example: She lightly brushed her hair back from her face. In this sentence, the action of brushing is performed gently rather than forcefully.

definition: Lightning is a natural, electrified discharge of very large electric currents between electrified cloud segments, or between a cloud and the ground. It usually occurs during a thunderstorm.
example: During the storm, I saw lightning flash across the dark sky, illuminating everything for a brief moment.

definition: To have a similar quality or resemble something; to have an affinity or fondness for (something or someone).
example: I'll help you, like you helped me last time.

definition: Likely refers to what is probable or seemingly sure to happen, based on available evidence or reason. It implies a high possibility of occurrence.
example: Given the sunny weather forecast, it's likely that we'll have a picnic in the park tomorrow.

definition: Likeness refers to a resemblance or similarity between two things, especially people or objects. It can be physical, behavioral, or in some other characteristic.
example: The children bore a strong likeness to their grandmother, with the same curly hair and bright blue eyes.

definition: Likewise means 'in the same way, similarly'. It is used to suggest a similar action or reaction to something that has been previously mentioned.
example: If John decides to study at night, Maria might decide to study likewise. This shows that Maria will choose to study at night in a similar manner as John.

definition: Lily is a type of flowering plant that belongs to the family Liliaceae. They are known for their large, showy flowers and often have six petals. Some common types include day lilies, tiger lilies, and water lilies.
example: The garden was filled with a sea of white lilies during the wedding ceremony.

definition: A limb is one of the four main appendages of an animal, typically consisting of the arm or leg. In humans, they include the arms, legs, and feet.
example: After the accident, John could no longer move his right limb. He needed surgery to fix it.

definition: Limit is a boundary or restriction beyond which something cannot go, either literally or metaphorically. It can also refer to the greatest number or size that a quantity or function can approach but not exceed.
example: The speed limit on this highway is 65 miles per hour. John couldn't run faster than his personal limit of 10 minutes for a one-mile race.

definition: A restriction or boundary placed on something, especially on an action or a person's freedom.
example: The town has a speed limit of 30 miles per hour to ensure the safety of its residents.

definition: Having restrictions or confined within certain bounds; not extensive, unbounded, or unlimited.
example: The number of tickets available for the concert is limited to 500.

definition: To limp is to walk with difficulty, often due to pain or an injury affecting one's leg or foot. It usually involves an abnormal gait where the affected leg does not touch the ground completely with each step.
example: After spraining his ankle during the game, John had to limp off the field.

definition: A line is a straight, unbroken path or mark extending indefinitely in both directions. It can be visualized as the shortest distance between any two points.
example: The road was a long and straight line, disappearing into the distant horizon.

definition: Linen is a strong, lightweight fabric made from flax plant fibers. It's often used for clothing, tablecloths, bedsheets, and other household textiles due to its absorbency and smooth finish.
example: She hung her freshly washed linen on the clothesline to dry under the summer sun.

definition: A liner is a large vessel, especially one used for transporting passengers or goods across long distances by sea.
example: The cruise ship was the largest liner in the fleet, capable of carrying thousands of passengers on its voyages around the world.

definition: Ling is a type of fish, specifically the common ling (Molva molva), which is a species of marine demersal fish in the family Lotidae. It is commonly found in northern European and North Atlantic waters.
example: I caught a large ling off the coast of Norway last week.

definition: To linger means to stay or remain for an extended period of time, often idly or unnecessarily. It can also refer to something that lingers as a lasting impression or memory.
example: After the sad goodbye, she couldn't help but linger near his house, hoping to catch a glimpse of him. In her memories, the fragrance of roses seemed to linger for an eternity.

definition: A link is a path or route between two points, especially when connected by something that allows movement, passage, or access. In digital terms, it is a hypertext that connects one document or webpage to another on the internet.
example: (Digital context) I found a fascinating article about AI and wanted to share it with you, so I sent you the link.

definition: A lion is a large, carnivorous mammal that belongs to the cat family (Felidae) and is identified by its tawny color, short tufts of hair on the face around the mouth, and a mane in the male.
example: The majestic lion roamed the savannah, surveying its territory with pride.

definition: The lip is a part of the mouth found on either side of the opening, consisting of two fleshy parts that are used for speech, eating, and expressing emotions.
example: She applied bright red lipstick before going to the party.

definition: Liquid is a state of matter that can flow and take the shape of its container, having no fixed shape of its own. It is neither a gas nor a solid; it is less dense than solids but denser than gases.
example: Water pours from the jug into the glass, transforming from liquid to liquid in the process.

definition: A list is an ordered sequence of items, typically written down or displayed in a particular order. It can contain words, numbers, or any combination of characters.
example: She made a shopping list with items like milk, bread, and eggs.

definition: To pay attention to and hear what someone is saying or playing. It can also imply understanding or considering something carefully.
example: "Please listen to me, I need your advice on this matter."

definition: A listener is a person who hears or pays attention to what is being said, sung, or played.
example: The audience was an attentive listener during the speaker's passionate speech.

definition: A liter (plural: liters or litres) is a unit of volume equal to one thousandth of a cubic meter. It is commonly used to measure liquids in the metric system.
example: She filled the watering can with five liters of water for the plants.

definition: The term "literal" refers to something that is taken exactly as it is written or spoken, without any additional interpretation, figurative meaning, or implication.
example: When John said, "I'm so hungry I could eat a horse," his friend replied, "You should have asked for food then. Don't be literal." In this context, the friend was asking John not to take the idiomatic expression literally. Instead, he wanted him to interpret it figuratively as expressing extreme hunger, rather than actually consuming a large animal.

definition: Used to emphasize that something is exactly or very true, not figurative or exaggerated. It can also be used humorously when the opposite of what is said is intended.
example: I'm so hungry I could eat a horse. (figuratively expressing extreme hunger) vs. I'm literally so hungry that if you give me a horse, I would eat it. (using "literally" to emphasize that the speaker means they are actually very hungry)

definition: Relating to literature or a particular style of expression in writing, especially that which is artistically and intellectually rewarding.
example: The novel was a literary masterpiece, with its deep exploration of human emotions and complex plotlines.

definition: Literature is a body of written works, typically representing cultural achievements or intellectual advancements in a given language and originating from a specific period. It encompasses genres such as poetry, novels, plays, and academic writing.
example: Emily Bronte's novel "Wuthering Heights" is an iconic piece of English literature that explores themes of love, revenge, and social class.

definition: Litter refers to waste material (such as garbage, rubbish, or trash) that is carelessly thrown away in a public place.
example: The park was filled with litter after the picnic, so we spent some time picking it up before leaving.

definition: A small amount or degree, not large in size, quantity, extent, or importance. Also used to denote a young child or someone who is smaller than others.
example: "She has a little sister who is very cute."

definition: To exist, continue in life, or experience the activities characteristic of living beings. It can also refer to the condition that maintains a person or thing able to function and grow.
example: Jane lives in a small town by the sea, where she enjoys sailing on weekends.

definition: Lively refers to something that is full of energy, spirit, or animation, often suggesting a state of high spirits, enthusiasm, or liveliness.
example: The children were very lively during the party, running and laughing all over the place.

definition: The liver is a large, complex organ located in the upper right quadrant of the abdominal cavity. It plays a crucial role in detoxifying chemicals, producing bile to aid digestion, storing glycogen for energy, and many other essential bodily functions.
example: After a heavy meal, the liver works diligently to break down fats and process alcohol.

definition: Living refers to the state of being alive, or the act of existing and functioning in a particular environment. It involves maintaining life processes such as breathing, eating, growing, reproducing, and responding to stimuli.
example: The plants are growing quickly in our backyard, demonstrating their lively existence.

definition: A living room is a room in a house where people gather for everyday activities and socializing. It's often used for relaxing, conversation, reading, watching television, or entertaining guests.
example: "After school, Sam went straight to the living room to do his homework while his mother prepared dinner."

definition: To load means to put something onto or into a vehicle, container, or other place with the intention of transporting it. It can also mean to provide (a computer, machine, etc.) with data, information, or programs so that it can operate effectively.
example: She loaded her car with groceries before heading home from the store.

definition: A loaf is a large piece of baked bread, usually formed into a rectangular or round shape.
example: "She bought a fresh loaf of whole grain bread for her sandwich."

definition: A loan is a sum of money lent by one party to another, which is usually required to be paid back at a later date, along with interest or additional fees.
example: John took out a loan from the bank to buy a new car. He will have to pay back the principal amount plus interest over the next five years.

definition: A lobby is a large open area or hall, typically found in public buildings such as hotels, office buildings, and legislative assemblies. It is also used figuratively to describe organized efforts by interest groups to influence decisions made by government officials or other powerful entities.
example: After the meeting, they gathered in the hotel lobby to discuss their next steps. In politics, various lobbies advocate for their causes, attempting to influence lawmakers and policies.

definition: Relating to or connected with a particular area or neighborhood.
example: The bakery is a local favorite, known for its fresh pastries and friendly service.

definition: To find or determine the position, place, or whereabouts of something or someone.
example: I need to locate my car keys before I can leave for work.

definition: A location is a specific place or position, either physical or virtual.
example: The restaurant is located on the corner of Main Street and Elm Avenue.

definition: A lock is a fastening device used to secure an opening or fasten items together. It typically consists of a mechanism that connects two parts, preventing them from being opened without a specific key or combination.
example: I forgot the combination for my gym locker, so I couldn't get my exercise clothes today.

definition: A lodge is a building used as temporary or permanent accommodations, especially in connection with outdoor activities such as hunting, camping, or tourism. It can also refer to the main building of a large estate.
example: The fraternity brother was elected to serve at the lodge for the upcoming year.

definition: A log is a record or account of events, transactions, or other significant information in chronological order. It can also refer to a large, cylindrical piece of wood from a tree trunk, particularly when used as fuel or for construction.
example: The system keeps a log of all user activities for security and troubleshooting purposes. In winter, they burned logs to keep their house warm.

definition: Logic is a systematic study of principles governing valid inference and correct reasoning. It involves using premises to draw conclusions that are supported by the evidence presented.
example: In a court trial, the lawyer uses logic when they present evidence and arguments to prove their client's innocence based on the information available. For instance, "Given that the defendant was seen at a movie theater at the time of the crime and DNA found at the scene does not match the defendant, it is reasonable to infer the defendant could not have committed the crime."

definition: Logical refers to something that is based on reason, sound judgment, or correct sequence of thinking. It involves consistent and coherent reasoning in making decisions or solving problems.
example: "John's argument was logical because he presented solid evidence and followed a clear line of reasoning."

definition: A logo is a graphic mark or emblem used to identify a company, organization, product, or brand. It typically consists of a symbol, name, or both.
example: The golden arches are the instantly recognizable logo for the McDonald's fast food chain.

definition: A feeling of sadness or emptiness caused by the absence or loss of companionship, whether from another person or a group of people. It's often characterized by feelings of isolation and desolation.
example: John felt a deep sense of loneliness when he moved to a new city where he didn't know anyone.

definition: Feeling sad because one has no friends or company, or is isolated and lacks communication with others. It can also refer to being alone when what one really wants is companionship.
example: Despite living in a bustling city, John often felt lonely because he had few friends to share his life with.

definition: Long refers to something that has a great extent in one or more dimensions, usually length but can also mean duration.
example: The bridge spanned a long distance across the river.

definition: Long-distance refers to something that extends over a considerable distance or communicates over such a distance, especially between people who are not living close together.
example: John and Sarah live in long-distance relationship as they work in different cities.

definition: Relating to or lasting for a considerable time into the future. Refers to something that continues over an extended period.
example: He has a long-term plan to build his own business.

definition: To direct one's eyes towards something or someone in order to see, observe, or inspect. It can also mean to have a particular expression or appearance.
example: She looked at the beautiful sunset with wonder. In another context, he had a confident look on his face before giving his presentation.

definition: Not tight or firmly fixed; movable or not fastened securely. Also, not strict or precise in meaning or application.
example: The dog's leash was loose, allowing him to run freely around the park.

definition: Loosely means not tightly or firmly fixed, not closely fitting, or not precisely or strictly in accordance with rules, conditions, or specifications. It can also imply an informal or flexible manner.
example: The pearl necklace slid loosely around her neck due to the lack of a clasp.

definition: A lorry (also known as a truck) is a large vehicle used to transport goods. It has an enclosed compartment, with wheels, for carrying the cargo.
example: "The lorry arrived early in the morning and unloaded a huge amount of furniture."

definition: To mislay or suffer the withdrawal from one's possession, control, or advantage; to fail to win or keep.
example: "I lost my keys in the park this morning."

definition: Loss refers to the act of depriving something or someone of possession, absence, or destruction. It can also refer to a decrease or reduction in amount or value.
example: After the storm, we suffered significant property loss.

definition: To lose or be unable to find something or someone; to no longer have something; to be confused, bewildered, or at a loss.
example: I lost my keys this morning and couldn't find them anywhere. I felt lost when I first started my new job because everything was so different from what I was used to.

definition: A lot refers to a large number or quantity, or a piece of land. It can also mean a share or chance in something.
example: Each student will get a lot in today's drawing. (share or chance)

definition: A lottery is a form of gambling in which numbers or symbols are drawn at random for a prize.
example: "John bought a ticket for the state lottery, hoping to win the jackpot."

definition: Loud refers to something that produces or has a great volume of sound. It is typically used to describe sounds that are too intense or excessive for comfort.
example: The fireworks were so loud that they startled the dogs in the neighborhood.

definition: Loudly refers to speaking, making noise, or producing sound at a high volume or intensity.
example: The drummer played loudly during the concert, causing some audience members to cover their ears.

definition: A loudspeaker is an electronic device that converts electrical energy into acoustic (sound) energy, typically used to amplify sound for broadcast in various settings.
example: "The DJ plugged her laptop into the large speakers, increasing the volume and getting the crowd excited for the next song."

definition: Lousy refers to something that is very poor in quality, unsatisfactory, or disappointing. It can also mean full of lice or vermin, but the common usage is related to being inferior or bad.
example: The food at that restaurant was lousy; I won't be going back there again.

definition: Love is a strong affection or attachment felt by an individual for another person, an object, or a concept. It often involves feelings of warmth, protectiveness, and deep appreciation.
example: She loves her dog so much that she takes it on long walks every day.

definition: Lovely refers to something that is pleasing, attractive, or charming in a way that inspires affection. It often signifies a delightful combination of qualities such as beauty, kindness, grace, and sweetness.
example: The sunset was lovely with hues of pink and orange painted across the sky.

definition: A lover is a person who has deep romantic feelings or affection for another. They are typically in a relationship characterized by strong emotional attachment and often, physical attraction.
example: Jane was a devoted lover to her partner, always making sure they felt appreciated and loved.

definition: Showing or characterized by affection, tenderness, or great care.
example: She lovingly prepared her grandmother's famous apple pie for the family gathering.

definition: The term "low" refers to something being situated or placed at a position that is not high, typically near the ground or close to zero. It can also describe a level, quantity, or amount that is small, minimal, or insufficient.
example: The water level in the swimming pool is low today, so they need to add more water.

definition: To make or become lower in position, amount, level, rank, etc. It can also mean to reduce the intensity or degree of something.
example: The bridge is too steep to descend, but if you lower the seat of your bicycle, it will be easier to ride down.

definition: Lowland refers to a region or area that is relatively flat or nearly level, often below high ground or the top of hills. It is usually close to sea level and has little elevation change.
example: The Amazon Rainforest covers vast lowlands in South America, stretching across Brazil, Peru, Colombia, and other countries.

definition: Loyal refers to being faithful, constant, or devoted to someone or something. It implies a strong sense of allegiance and unwavering support.
example: Despite his friend moving to another city, John remained loyal and visited him every weekend for the next year.

definition: Loyalty refers to a strong feeling of support or allegiance towards someone or something. It is a constant and unwavering commitment to a cause, person, or group.
example: Despite many job offers from competitors, John remained loyal to his company because he believed in its mission and values.

definition: Luck is the success or advantage seeming to come by chance rather than through one's own actions.
example: She won the lottery, it was just plain luck.

definition: Luckily means in a fortunate or favorable manner, often implying that an unfavorable situation has been avoided or turned into something better.
example: Despite the heavy rain, we luckily found shelter before it started pouring heavily, saving us from getting wet.

definition: Lucky means having favorable circumstances or opportunities, often implying good fortune or success.
example: Despite the tough competition, Sarah won the lottery, considering herself extremely lucky that day.

definition: Lucrative refers to something that is profitable or financially successful.
example: The position of a CEO in a tech company can be quite lucrative due to the high salary and stock options.

definition: Luggage refers to large bags, cases, or containers used to transport personal items when traveling.
example: "Remember to check the weight of your luggage before heading to the airport, as overweight bags may incur additional fees."

definition: Lunch is the meal eaten in the middle of the day, often during a break from work or school. It is usually light compared to breakfast and dinner.
example: "After working for four hours, I took a break for lunch and had a sandwich, fruit salad, and a cup of tea."

definition: Lunchtime is the period of the day during which one typically eats lunch.
example: "Let's meet for lunch at 1 o'clock, it's almost my lunchtime."

definition: Lung is one of two organs in the chest of humans and other vertebrates responsible for gas exchange (taking in oxygen and expelling carbon dioxide) through breathing.
example: The smoker coughed violently, a sign that his lungs were struggling with years of tobacco use.

definition: Lush refers to something that is abundant in growth, lushness or luxuriance, typically rich and verdant foliage. It can also be used to describe something that is rich, plentiful, or sensuously luxurious.
example: The garden was filled with lush green plants and vibrant flowers after the heavy rainfall.

definition: Luxurious refers to something that is richly furnished, sumptuously appointed, or very comfortable and expensive. It suggests indulgence and high-quality materials.
example: The hotel offered luxurious suites with marble bathrooms and a personal butler.

definition: Luxury refers to something that is of high quality, expensive, and provides comfort, pleasure, or great delight. It is often associated with opulence, indulgence, and pampering oneself.
example: She booked a luxury suite at the five-star hotel for their honeymoon, complete with a private Jacuzzi and a breathtaking view of the city.

definition: A lyric is a stanza or verse of a song, typically expressing feelings and emotions through poetic language.
example: The lyrics of the song "Yesterday" by The Beatles go: "And when I woke up this mornin', surprising as can be, I'd dreamt that little dream of you and me."

definition: Lyrics are the words of a song, often including verses and choruses, and sometimes other poetic elements such as rhyme or meter. They convey the story, emotion, and theme of the song, usually set to music and sung by the artist.
example: The lyrics to "Bohemian Rhapsody" by Queen are a dramatic narrative that tells a story about a man who is murdered and meets God.

definition: An abbreviation of the pronoun "am," used in first person singular present tense contractions in English, such as "I am" or "it is." It is used to save space and improve the flow of speech.
example: "I'm going to the store." (This means "I am going to the store.")

definition: A machine is a device that uses energy to perform work or mechanical feats. It can be manually controlled or operated automatically, and it often consists of interrelated parts arranged in a systematic manner.
example: The robot vacuum cleaner is a modern machine designed to move around the house and pick up dirt without human intervention.

definition: Crazy, furious, or extremely angry.
example: "John was mad with jealousy when he saw his girlfriend dancing with another man."

definition: Madam is a title of respect used for a woman, especially one of high social status or in formal situations.
example: "Good morning, Madam President. How may I assist you today?"

definition: Madame is a French honorific title used to address a married woman, especially when she holds a position of respect or authority. It is often translated as "Ms." in English.
example: "Madame President, may I present the annual budget report for your consideration."

definition: Madness refers to severe, unreasonable, or chaotic behavior, often used to describe an extreme mental illness. It can also imply a state of frenzy, irrationality, or insanity.
example: John's madness became evident when he started talking to inanimate objects and believed they were his friends.

definition: A maestro is a title given to a highly skilled and distinguished conductor of an orchestra or choir, usually implying a level of exceptional talent and experience.
example: The maestro led the symphony with precision and passion, eliciting a standing ovation from the enthralled audience.

definition: A magazine is a publication containing a variety of articles, stories, or pictures, usually on a specific theme and released periodically. It can be printed on paper or available in digital format.
example: She enjoys reading fashion magazines like Vogue for inspiration on the latest styles.

definition: Magic is the power of manipulating or influencing things by using mysterious or supernatural forces. It is often associated with illusion, enchantment, and supernatural powers.
example: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, amazing everyone in the audience with his magic trick.

definition: Something magical is extraordinary, unexplainable, or possessing an enchanting quality that seems to defy the laws of nature.
example: The fireflies dancing in the summer night looked like a magical display.

definition: A magician is a person who practices magic, often entertaining an audience by creating illusions, performing tricks, or seemingly exhibiting supernatural powers.
example: The boy was amazed as the magician made the rabbit disappear from his hat during the magic show at the carnival.

definition: Magnificent refers to something that is extremely beautiful, impressively great, or majestically powerful.
example: The sunset over the ocean was truly magnificent, with hues of pink and orange blending together in a breathtaking display of nature's beauty.

definition: To make something appear larger or more prominent, often through enlargement or emphasis.
example: When examining a tiny insect under a magnifying glass, we can magnify its features to understand its structure better.

definition: Mail refers to the system of posting letters, parcels, or other small packages to a recipient at a different location. It often involves using envelopes or boxes and is typically delivered by a postal service.
example: "I forgot to mail my friend's birthday card; I need to drop it off at the post office on my way home from work."

definition: A mailbox is a post or box, usually located near a residence or office, designed to hold incoming mail delivered by the postal service.
example: "I checked the mailbox this morning and found a letter from my grandma."

definition: The term "main" generally refers to something that is primary, principal, or most important. It can also denote the central or largest part of a system, object, or structure.
example: In the sentence, "The main road leads directly to the city center," 'main' refers to the primary or most significant road in this context.

definition: The main course, also known as the entrÃ©e, is the central and most substantial dish served in a meal during the principal or middle part of it. It often consists of meat, fish, or vegetables prepared in an elaborate manner.
example: During their dinner party, they served grilled salmon with a lemon dill sauce as the main course.

definition: Mainly refers to something that is predominantly or chiefly of a particular kind, quality, or aspect. It often implies a concentration or emphasis on one thing rather than another.
example: I mainly study math and science because I'm interested in technology.

definition: To keep in an existing condition, to continue something, or to support a belief, argument, etc.
example: She maintains the garden every week by watering and weeding it regularly.

definition: The action of maintaining something, especially keeping it in good working order by repairing or replacing parts if necessary.
example: "John spends every weekend doing maintenance on his car to ensure it runs smoothly."

definition: A major is a principal subject of study in a university or college, often requiring a more extensive and specialized course of instruction compared to minor subjects. It also refers to something that is significant, large, or important.
example: Her major at university was Computer Science, which she found fascinating. In their city, crime was a major concern for the community.

definition: The majority refers to more than half of the total number or amount in a group or set. It is often used to describe the larger portion that has more influence or power when decisions are being made.
example: In the school election, the majority voted for Sarah to be the new class president.

definition: To produce or cause something to happen or exist. It often implies an action or process that transforms raw materials, time, and effort into a product or outcome.
example: She made a beautiful cake for her daughter's birthday.

definition: A maker is someone who creates things, especially using skill or ingenuity, often involving craftsmanship, innovation, or construction.
example: John is a maker; he enjoys making handcrafted wooden furniture in his workshop.

definition: Make-up refers to cosmetics and beauty products used to enhance or alter a person's appearance.
example: She applied her make-up carefully before the job interview, ensuring she looked professional yet attractive.

definition: Malady refers to a disease, illness, or any other physical or mental condition that causes pain, distress, or dysfunction.
example: She was diagnosed with a malady that required immediate medical attention.

definition: Malaria is a serious, mosquito-borne disease caused by parasites that invade and attack the red blood cells in humans. It is prevalent in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Africa, Asia, and Latin America.
example: The doctor diagnosed the traveler with malaria after her return from a trip to a region where the disease is common. She was immediately prescribed antimalarial medication to treat it.

definition: A male is an individual organism that produces sperm, typically having characteristics such as a deeper voice, facial hair, and XY chromosomes in humans. In general terms, it refers to the sex or gender opposite of female.
example: The lion in the zoo is male because he has a mane.

definition: A mall is a large, enclosed commercial structure with multiple stores, restaurants, and entertainment facilities arranged along a central path or concourse.
example: "We spent the afternoon shopping at the mall for new clothes and sneakers."

definition: "Mama" or "Mamma" is an informal term used to refer to a mother in English, predominantly in the United States and some Italian-speaking regions.
example: "When I was a child, I would always run to my mama when I scraped my knee."

definition: A man is an adult human male. In broader context, man can also refer to humankind in general.
example: The man at the counter ordered a cup of coffee. (Specific reference to an adult human male)

definition: To handle or control a task, process, or a group of people efficiently. It involves organizing, planning, directing, and coordinating resources to achieve desired results.
example: John manages the sales team effectively by setting clear goals, providing necessary training, and monitoring their progress regularly.

definition: Management refers to the process of organizing, planning, directing, and controlling resources (such as human, financial, or material) to achieve specific goals in an efficient and effective manner. It involves decision-making, delegation, coordination, and monitoring progress to ensure objectives are met.
example: The project manager is responsible for the management of team members, budget, timeline, and deliverables to successfully complete the software development project within the specified time frame.

definition: A manager is a person who is responsible for overseeing and directing the work of others in an organization, department or team. They plan, coordinate, and evaluate the activities of their team to achieve organizational objectives efficiently and effectively.
example: "The project manager is responsible for ensuring that the team delivers the project on time and within budget."

definition: Mango is a juicy tropical fruit with an edible pulp and a large, flat, often kidney-shaped pit. It is native to South Asia but widely cultivated in tropic and subtropic areas worldwide.
example: I sliced a ripe mango and enjoyed the sweet, tangy flavor while sitting on the porch.

definition: To control or handle a person or thing skillfully, often in a deceitful manner.
example: The salesperson successfully manipulated the customer into purchasing an expensive product by using persuasive tactics.

definition: Mankind refers to all human beings collectively. It is a term often used in contexts that emphasize the unity of humanity.
example: "Mankind must come together to address global issues such as climate change and poverty."

definition: The way in which something is done or how someone behaves, especially with regard to politeness and respect.
example: "She spoke in a very polite manner."

definition: A large, luxurious house, especially one with many rooms, often on a spacious estate.
example: The wealthy businessman owns a grand mansion overlooking the ocean.

definition: A manual is a document or guide that provides instructions on how to perform a task, operate a machine, or use a product effectively. It is often written in a step-by-step format and may include illustrations or diagrams.
example: When assembling the new bicycle, consult the provided manual for clear instructions on each step.

definition: Manufacture refers to the making of goods or products on a large scale, typically using machinery. It involves transforming raw materials into finished products through various processes such as assembly, construction, and packaging.
example: The company manufactures smartphones in their facility, producing thousands every day.

definition: A manufacturer is an individual, company, or organization that produces goods on a large scale for sale or distribution to retailers, businesses, or directly to consumers.
example: The car manufacturer Toyota has announced plans to expand its electric vehicle production in response to growing consumer demand for eco-friendly vehicles.

definition: Manufacturing is the process of making products on a large scale using machinery, tools, and combined labor. It involves taking raw materials and transforming them into finished goods through various stages such as designing, fabrication, assembly, testing, and packaging.
example: The company manufactures cars by assembling engine parts, seats, wheels, and other components to create a complete vehicle.

definition: Many refers to a large but unspecified number greater than two or more than a few. It is used to describe multiple items, people, or occurrences that are more than a handful.
example: "Many people attended the concert last night."

definition: A map is a visual representation of an area, typically on a flat surface, that shows the physical features, locations, and relations between places. It can represent territories, regions, or an entire continent.
example: "John used the road map to navigate through unfamiliar cities during his cross-country road trip."

definition: Maple is a hardwood tree belonging to the Sapindaceae (soapberry) family, with over 100 species, but mainly known for its five major species in North America. Its leaves are palmate, lobed, and usually deciduous, turning attractive autumn colors before falling off. The tree's bark is characterized by horizontal ridges. Maple trees are well-known for their sweet sap from which maple syrup is produced.
example: During the fall season, the vibrant red and orange leaves of the maple tree painted a stunning picture against the clear blue sky.

definition: A marathon is a long-distance road race with a distance of 42.195 kilometers (26 miles and 385 yards). It's the classic test of distance running, typically requiring extensive training and physical endurance.
example: Last summer, John completed his first marathon in New York City, finishing the race in just under four hours.

definition: Marble is a metamorphic rock composed of recrystallized carbonate minerals, most commonly calcite or dolomite. It often has a smooth, polished surface and comes in various colors and patterns.
example: The statue was intricately carved from a beautiful white marble.

definition: March is the third month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, consisting of 31 days. It is also a verb that means to walk with purpose or energy, often used for a large group of people moving together.
example: (As a verb) Thousands of people marched in the city to protest against climate change.

definition: March refers to a walk with a regular step, typically in a straight line or along a street, especially as part of a demonstration, ceremony, parade, or military movement. It can also mean the act or progression forward, symbolizing forward movement or advancement.
example: Thousands of people marched down Main Street to protest against the proposed tax increase. During the school year, students have to march in line from one class to another.

definition: Margin refers to the space or border around the edge of something, such as a page, a frame, or a financial instrument. In finance, margin also means the amount of money that a borrower must deposit as collateral when buying securities on credit.
example: The artist added a wide white margin around her sketch to make it stand out on the black background.

definition: Relating to the sea or ocean, marine life, or naval forces.
example: The scientist studies the behavior of marine species in their natural habitats.

definition: A mark is a visible sign, symbol, or indication made on a surface to show, identify, or distinguish something.
example: The teacher marked an X on the correct answer sheet.

definition: To leave a noticeable sign or impression on something, often implying a change or distinction.
example: The teacher marked the student's paper with red ink to highlight errors and suggestions for improvement.

definition: A market is a place, especially a town or city square, where daily provisions are sold. It can also refer to the activity of buying and selling goods or services, either in a particular place or generally.
example: She went to the farmers' market every Saturday to buy fresh vegetables for her meals.

definition: Marketing is the process of identifying, anticipating, and satisfying customer needs and wants through the creation, promotion, distribution, and delivery of valuable products, services, or experiences.
example: The company launched an extensive marketing campaign for their new smartphone model, using social media influencers to promote it, creating eye-catching advertisements for billboards, and organizing product demonstrations at local stores.

definition: Marriage is a legally or formally recognized union between two people that is established by a civil or religious ceremony. It is a special commitment between partners, typically involving mutual consent, love, and a legal agreement that gives both parties rights and obligations.
example: "John and Jane got married in a beautiful beach wedding last summer."

definition: The state of being joined in matrimony, a legally binding union between two people, usually as husband and wife.
example: John and Jane are married now and live together in a beautiful house by the lake.

definition: To enter into a legal union recognized by law as a husband and wife, usually implying romantic love and the intention to live together.
example: Jane decided to marry John after they had been dating for several years.

definition: A martial art is a system of combat or self-defense techniques that originated in various countries such as China, Japan, and India. It often includes elements like striking, grappling, and weapon-based skills, with its own unique philosophy and principles.
example: John has been practicing karate for ten years, a traditional Japanese martial art known for its emphasis on precision, speed, and power in kicking and punching techniques.

definition: Marvelous or Marvellous means extremely impressive, wonderful, or extraordinary. It's often used to express admiration or surprise at something remarkable.
example: The performance of the young violinist was marvelous; everyone in the audience was mesmerized by her skill and talent.

definition: To mash means to pound, beat, or press food (such as potatoes) until it becomes soft and mushy. It's often done with a tool like a potato masher or fork.
example: After boiling the potatoes, I mashed them with a fork and added some milk, butter, and salt to make creamy mashed potatoes.

definition: A mask is a covering worn over the mouth, face, or eyes to protect against harmful substances, disguise one's identity, or for ceremonial purposes.
example: She wore a mask during the sandstorm to protect her lungs from dust.

definition: Mass refers to a large quantity or amount of something, especially three-dimensional physical matter that has volume and weight. It is often used in terms of size, number, or amount.
example: The mass of the books on the shelf is too heavy for one person to lift easily.

definition: A massacre is a violent event in which a large number of people are killed, typically by soldiers or military forces. It often implies an indiscriminate slaughter and a disregard for human life.
example: The massacre at My Lai was a turning point during the Vietnam War where hundreds of unarmed civilians were killed by American soldiers.

definition: Massage is a manipulation of soft body tissues (muscles, tendons, and ligaments) to enhance a person's health and well-being. It involves applying fixed or movable pressure at various depths and using a series of strokes, kneading, rubbing, and vibration.
example: "After her long day at work, she decided to relax with a soothing massage to alleviate the tension in her shoulders."

definition: A masseur is a person who practices massage therapy, typically to relieve tension and pain in the body. They are often professionals who have undergone training in the art of massage.
example: "After a long day at work, I went for a relaxing massage from my local masseur to ease the knots in my shoulders."

definition: Extremely large or heavy in size or amount.
example: The massive mountain range stretches across the horizon.

definition: A master is an expert or someone who has superior skill in a particular subject, craft, or art. It can also refer to the owner of a ship or the head of a household.
example: John is a master painter; his artwork sells for thousands of dollars. Or, Captain Smith was the master of the ship during our voyage across the Atlantic.

definition: A masterpiece is a creation of outstanding artistry, skill, or intellectuality, considered a greatest work by an artist or craftsperson within their field.
example: Leonardo da Vinci's "Mona Lisa" is often referred to as a masterpiece due to its intricate details and the enigmatic smile of its subject.

definition: Mastery refers to a high level of skill, knowledge, or control in a particular subject or activity, usually indicating proficiency and expertise.
example: After years of practice, John had mastered the art of oil painting. His works were admired by many for their intricate details and lifelike quality.

definition: A match is an item used to ignite fire, typically consisting of a small stick of material that catches fire at one end when struck against a hard surface. It provides a flame for a short period of time.
example: I need a match to light the gas stove.

definition: A close friend or companion, often used informally. In Australian and New Zealand English, it can also refer to any friend.
example: "I've known John since we were kids; he's my mate."

definition: Material refers to any substance or matter, typically used for making something. It can be solid, liquid, gas, or even an idea.
example: The architect used various materials like steel, glass, and concrete to construct the modern skyscraper.

definition: Math or Maths refers to the study of numbers, quantities, shapes, and structures. It encompasses various fields such as algebra, geometry, calculus, statistics, and more.
example: "I'm struggling with my math homework tonight." (In American English, it would be "math", while in British English, it could also be "maths").

definition: Relating to or involving mathematics, i.e., the study of numbers, quantity, and space, using logical reasoning to solve problems. It includes various fields such as algebra, geometry, calculus, and statistics.
example: The mathematical formula for determining the area of a rectangle is length times width.

definition: A mathematician is a professional or an academic who uses mathematical methods, processes, and theories to solve problems, answer questions, or to understand relationships among quantities, shapes, and structures.
example: The renowned mathematician, Dr. Ada Lovelace, was recognized for her groundbreaking work on Charles Babbage's analytical engine, which laid the foundation for modern computer programming.

definition: Mathematics is a branch of knowledge that deals with numbers, quantities, and their relationships. It includes various sub-fields such as algebra, geometry, calculus, and statistics, among others.
example: John was solving equations in algebra class, which is part of mathematics.

definition: Matter refers to any substance that has mass and occupies space. It can be solid, liquid, gas, or plasma.
example: "The matter in the glass of water takes up space and has weight, making it possible for us to feel it and measure its properties."

definition: Mature refers to a state of emotional, mental, or physical development that is full-grown or fully developed. It can also indicate an age where such development has occurred.
example: John's mature behavior during the crisis demonstrated his wisdom and self-control.

definition: A mausoleum is a large tomb built to house the remains of a prominent person or people, usually above ground. It is often an elaborate structure with decorative elements and may be located in a cemetery or as a standalone monument.
example: The Taj Mahal in India is a famous example of a mausoleum, built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan for his wife Mumtaz Mahal in the mid-17th century.

definition: Max is an abbreviation that generally stands for maximum, which means the greatest or highest amount, degree, extent, or number within a particular group, collection, or range.
example: In this math problem, the maximum sum of points you can earn is max 100 points per game, so your total score cannot exceed 300 points.

definition: The maximum refers to the greatest or highest point, extent, or amount. It is the upper limit of a range or series of numbers.
example: The temperature on this day reached its maximum at 95 degrees Fahrenheit.

definition: The auxiliary verb "may" is used to express possibility, permission, or politeness in a request. It suggests that something is allowed or could happen, but it is not necessarily certain.
example: "You may sit down if you like." (This sentence implies that the speaker allows or permits the listener to sit down.)

definition: May refers to the fifth month of the year, or it can be used as a verb meaning to permit or allow. It can also be used as a modal auxiliary verb to express possibility or request permission.
example: 1) The flowers will bloom in May. (Date)

definition: "Maybe" is an adverb or auxiliary verb used to express uncertainty, doubt, or possibility. It suggests that something is a possibility but is not certain.
example: "Maybe I should take an umbrella today, it might rain."

definition: A mayor is the head of a municipal government, elected or appointed to serve in cities, towns, or counties.
example: "The current mayor of our city is running for re-election."

definition: "Me" is a pronoun used to refer to oneself.
example: I am going to the park, but I don't want to go alone, can you come with me?

definition: A meal is a set of food or drink typically consumed at one time, especially one serving as a single course at a particular time of day.
example: "We usually have breakfast around 7 AM, lunch at noon, and dinner at 6 PM - these are our daily meals."

definition: Mean can have two main meanings in English. Firstly, it can refer to an average value calculated by adding up all values and dividing by the count. Secondly, it can be used as a synonym for cruel or unkind.
Meaning refers to the thing that is understood or conveyed by someone or something, such as a word or action. It's the essence or significance behind an action, object, or word.
example: The meaning of the word "home" can vary greatly depending on personal experiences, but generally, it refers to one's place of residence or where one feels most comfortable and safe. For instance, "My home is not just a building; it's a place filled with memories and love."

definition: Having significance or importance, expressing a purpose or concept that is not trivial. It can also refer to something that has emotional depth or value beyond its literal interpretation.
example: The conversation with her grandmother about family history was meaningful because it connected them across generations and enriched their understanding of each other.

definition: A way or method to achieve an end; a tool, resource, or series of actions used to reach a goal.
example: The bus is the means of transportation for many commuters in this city.

definition: "Meanwhile" is an adverb that indicates a continuation or progression of events while something else is happening simultaneously. It emphasizes the simultaneous occurrence of two or more things.
example: "John was studying for his exam, and meanwhile, Mary was watching TV."

definition: To measure means to determine the size, amount, or quantity of something using standard units.
example: She took out a tape measure to ensure that the picture would fit perfectly on the wall.

definition: Measurement is the process of quantifying the attributes or properties of an object, event, or system using numbers or symbols.
example: In taking the temperature of a room using a thermometer, you are performing a measurement to determine the temperature in degrees Celsius or Fahrenheit.

definition: Meat is the edible tissues of an animal's body, particularly skeletal muscle and its fat. It is a common food source in many diets around the world.
example: John grilled a juicy steak for dinner last night.

definition: A mechanic is a person who repairs and maintains vehicles, machinery, or equipment.
example: The car won't start in the morning, I think I need to take it to the mechanic.

definition: Relating to machinery or machines, or operated by machinery. Also, performed or done in a repetitive, automatic, or impersonal way without intelligence or imagination.
example: The clock's movement is purely mechanical; it doesn't require electricity to keep time. The assembly line at the factory was designed to maximize mechanical efficiency.

definition: To make or do something by machinery, automate. It can also refer to the process of converting manual processes into mechanical operations.
example: The factory mechanized its assembly line in order to increase productivity and efficiency.

definition: A medal is a flat, circular piece of metal or similar material that is awarded to recognize accomplishments, bravery, or merit.
example: The athlete received a gold medal for winning the marathon race at the Olympics.

definition: Media refers to the main means of communication, such as newspapers, magazines, television, radio, and the internet, that are relied upon as sources of news, entertainment, and information.
example: She spends most of her day consuming various forms of media, from watching TV shows to reading online articles about current events.

definition: Relating to medicine, the investigation of the human body and its diseases for the purpose of preventing, diagnosing, curing, or alleviating injury or disorder.
example: The patient was referred to a medical specialist for further examination of her chronic back pain.

definition: Medication refers to any drug or other substance used as a remedy for diseases or to treat their symptoms. It can be in the form of pills, liquids, ointments, or injections.
example: The doctor prescribed an antibiotic medication for the bacterial infection.

definition: Medicine refers to the science or practice of the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease using remedies, drugs, or procedures. It is a healthcare profession that encompasses pharmacy, medical laboratory science, and many other health-related sciences.
example: After being diagnosed with pneumonia, the doctor prescribed a course of antibiotics as medicine to help her recover.

definition: The term "medieval" or "mediaeval" refers to the period in Western history that spans roughly from the 5th century AD to the 15th century, often associated with feudalism, castles, knights, and the Catholic Church. It is the middle age between the fall of the Roman Empire and the beginning of the Renaissance.
example: The castle, built during the medieval period, still stands as a testament to that era's architectural grandeur.

definition: Mediocre refers to something that is neither good nor bad, but rather of average quality or ability.
example: The teacher's performance in the school play was mediocre; it neither impressed the audience nor stood out as particularly poor.

definition: Meditate refers to the practice of focusing one's mind on a specific object, thought, or activity, often for religious or spiritual purposes, in order to achieve mental clarity and peace. It can also be done for stress reduction or self-improvement.
example: Every morning, John takes 20 minutes to meditate, focusing on his breath to clear his mind and start the day with a peaceful frame of mind.

definition: Meditation is a mental practice that involves focusing one's mind on a specific object, thought, or activity to train attention and awareness, and achieve a mentally clear and emotionally calm state.
example: Every morning, John takes a few minutes to meditate by focusing his thoughts on his breath, helping him start his day with a peaceful and focused mind.

definition: Mediterranean refers to a sea that connects Europe, Africa, and Asia, or any geographical region with a similar climate (warm and dry summers, mild and wet winters) surrounding this sea. The term is also used to describe the culture, cuisine, or landscape of these regions.
example: The traditional Mediterranean diet emphasizes fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and healthy fats, with olive oil as a main ingredient, like in this Greek salad recipe.

definition: A medium is a means of communication or transportation, typically one that is not solid. It can also refer to a person who claims to be able to communicate with spirits or the supernatural.
example: The psychic claimed to be a medium, connecting with spirits on the other side. (In this context, medium refers to the person's alleged ability to communicate with the supernatural.)

definition: To come together or arrive at the same time or place; to have a planned encounter.
example: "I will meet you at the coffee shop at 3 PM."

definition: A meeting is an organized gathering of people, typically at a specific time and place, to discuss, make decisions, or coordinate activities. It can be formal, informal, private, or public, depending on the context.
example: "The project team has scheduled a meeting tomorrow morning to discuss the upcoming deadline."

definition: A series of single musical tones, usually successive and pleasing in arrangement, that form a sequence recognized as a unit and considered to have a body, soul, or meaning of its own.
