definition: Information about recent events or happenings, often reported in newspapers, magazines, on television, or online.
example: "The news announced that a new vaccine for COVID-19 has been approved for public use."

definition: A newscaster is a person who presents news and current events on television or radio programs.
example: "The popular newscaster delivered the evening news with professionalism and accuracy, keeping viewers informed about the day's most significant events."

definition: A newspaper is a regularly published printed periodical containing news, articles, and advertisements about current events, issues, and other matters of public interest.
example: John reads the morning newspaper every day to stay updated on local and international news.

definition: Newsworthy refers to information, events, or developments that are significant, interesting, and important enough to be reported by the media.
example: The discovery of a new species in the Amazon rainforest is considered newsworthy due to its potential impact on our understanding of biodiversity.

definition: The term "next" is an adjective, pronoun, or adverb that refers to something coming after the current position in a sequence or time. It is used to indicate a following event, person, or thing.
example: "I will meet you at the movies next week." In this sentence, "next" is an adverb indicating the week immediately following the present one for the meeting to take place.

definition: Next door refers to the house, building, or property located immediately on one side of another. It implies a neighboring location.
example: The Smiths live next door to us and always have freshly baked cookies on Tuesdays.

definition: Next to means in immediate proximity, or very near. It is often used to describe the location of one object or place relative to another.
example: The library is next to the town square.

definition: "Next-door" refers to the neighboring house, property, or location that is immediately adjacent. It implies proximity and often a sense of familiarity.
example: "I forgot my keys at home, can I borrow some from my next-door neighbor?"

definition: Pleasant, agreeable, kind, amiable, and attractive. Refers to something or someone that is enjoyable or satisfying to be around.
example: The weather was quite nice today, perfect for a walk in the park.

definition: Nicely refers to something that is done or presented in a way that is pleasing, skillfully, or elegantly. It implies a sense of polish and care.
example: She nicely arranged the flowers in the vase, creating a beautiful centerpiece for the table.

definition: A nickname is an informal name or term used to refer to a person, group, or thing, often as a shortened version of their real name, or given in recognition of a characteristic, habit, or occupation. It's usually more casual and familiar than the original name.
example: Despite being called Michael at birth, most people call him Mike due to his nickname being a common short form of his name.

definition: A niece is the daughter of one's brother or sister.
example: My sister has two beautiful daughters, so I have a niece who just started college.

definition: Night refers to the period of darkness that occurs between sunset and sunrise. It is typically associated with rest, sleep, and a decrease in activity levels.
example: "After work, I walked my dog before the night fell."

definition: A nightclub is an entertainment venue, typically open in the evenings or at night, where people can dance, drink, and socialize to music played by a disc jockey or live band.
example: Every Friday evening, many young adults head to their favorite nightclub for a fun-filled night of dancing and mingling with friends.

definition: Nightlife refers to the array of entertainment and socializing that occurs after dark, typically involving restaurants, bars, clubs, concerts, or other activities.
example: "The city's nightlife was vibrant with bustling bars, live music venues, and lively street performers."

definition: A nightmare is a terrifying or extremely difficult experience or situation that happens in one's sleep (a dream) or waking life, causing fear, anxiety, and distress.
example: "The public speaking competition was a nightmare for her, as she always froze up on stage."

definition: Nine is a number, the natural number following eight and preceding ten. It is denoted by the Arabic numeral 9.
example: There are nine apples in this basket.

definition: Nineteen is a number, the positive integer that comes immediately after eighteen and before twenty in sequence.
example: The player scored nineteen points in the basketball game.

definition: Ninety is a number, the product of 10 and 9. It's a cardinal number used to represent an amount or quantity.
example: I have ninety apples in my basket.

definition: "No" is an interjection or adverb used to express denial, refusal, disagreement, or rejection. It can also be used negatively to indicate the absence of something.
example: I cannot come to your party tonight; I have other plans. (Here, "no" indicates a refusal.)

definition: "No one" refers to an individual or individuals who are not present, not existent, or not involved in a specific situation. It is used to negate the existence or involvement of any person.
example: "No one came to the party last night." (This means that there was no attendance at the party the previous evening.)

definition: Nobility refers to high social rank or status, often associated with titles such as duke, marquis, earl, viscount, baron, or lord. It was traditionally a rank in the feudal system of Medieval Europe.
example: The Duke of Edinburgh, who passed away in 2021, was a member of British nobility.

definition: Having or showing lofty, unselfish, and socially superior qualities; of high rank, title, or station.
example: The king's actions demonstrated great nobility by giving up his throne for the good of his people.

definition: A nobleman is a title given to a high-ranking member of the feudal aristocracy in medieval Europe, often holding significant political power and social influence.
example: King Henry appointed Sir Edward, his nobleman, as the governor of the province during his absence.

definition: Nobody refers to no person or group of persons. It is used to denote a lack of existence, presence, or identification of any specific individual.
example: Nobody saw the thief during the robbery.

definition: Nod is a brief movement of the head up and down, typically used to signify agreement, acknowledgment, or understanding. It can also be a reflex in response to sound or touch.
example: When John's boss agreed with his idea during the meeting, he nodded his head in approval.

definition: Unwanted or disturbing sound, interference, or disorder. It can also refer to unnecessary information or distraction.
example: The loud music from the neighbor's house is just noise to me since I need silence to focus on my work.

definition: Making or producing an unusually loud, harsh, or disturbing sound.
example: The car engine revved noisily during the race.

definition: Noisy refers to a situation, environment, or object that produces a lot of noise or sound, often in an unpleasant or distracting manner.
example: The construction site next door was noisy during the day, making it difficult for her to focus on her work from home.

definition: A nomad is a person who does not have a fixed residence and moves from place to place, usually an independent wanderer roaming the world or a region. They are typically associated with traditional pastoral societies that follow their herds of livestock.
example: The tribe were nomads, constantly moving across the vast desert in search of fresh water and grazing lands for their camels.

definition: The act of proposing someone for an honor, position, or award.
example: John was nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize due to his humanitarian efforts worldwide.

definition: A nominee is a person or entity designated to act on behalf of another in specific matters. They are typically appointed for an award, office, or position but do not have any legal ownership until transferred.
example: The board of directors has selected John Doe as the nominee for the position of CEO. If he is elected, John will officially become the new CEO of the company.

definition: The term "none" refers to nothing, no quantity, or no individual members of a group. It often negates the existence or occurrence of something.
example: I have no apples, only oranges - none.

definition: Nonetheless is an adverb used to introduce a statement that, although contrary to what has been said before or expected, is not contradictory but supports the preceding point in a new light. It implies despite this, nevertheless, still, all the same.
example: I was planning to go to the concert, but I have a headache nonetheless; I think I'll stay home instead.

definition: A nonprofessional is a person who does not have formal training, expertise, or experience in a particular field, especially someone who does not work full-time in a profession.
example: John is a nonprofessional painter, as he only paints during his free time and doesn't sell his artworks to earn a living.

definition: Nonsense refers to statements or ideas that are irrational, unintelligible, or meaningless. It is often used to describe something absurd or foolish.
example: The professor's explanation about the quantum multiverse was complete nonsense to me. I had no idea what he was talking about.

definition: Relating to or being a place where smoking is prohibited.
example: The flight I'm on is a non-smoking flight, so please put your cigarette out.

definition: Noon is the precise moment when the sun is directly overhead and a day is halfway completed.
example: It's exactly noon, let's have lunch!

definition: "Nor" is a conjunction used to negate or reject two alternatives, often when connecting clauses. It is the opposite of "or.".
example: I can't play basketball nor swim because I have a broken arm.

definition: Normal refers to something that is typical, usual, ordinary, or average in comparison to other things of the same kind. It implies conformity to a standard or expectation.
example: Jane's blood pressure reading was normal, indicating it was within the typical range for her age and health condition.

definition: Normally refers to what usually happens, is typical or expected in a given situation.
example: In this weather, people normally wear coats and scarves outside.

definition: North is a cardinal direction that is opposite to south, and it indicates the side of a place or object farthest from an imaginary line towards the equator.
example: The train station is located in the north part of the city.

definition: Northeast refers to a cardinal direction or region that is located at the top right side of a map, between east and north. It can also refer to specific geographical regions such as the Northeastern United States or the Northeast of England.
example: The northeast monsoon brings heavy rains to the Philippines every year from November to February.

definition: Northeastern refers to or pertains to the geographical region that lies in the northeast of a larger area, typically encompassing states or provinces in the United States or Canada. It is often associated with states like Maine, New Hampshire, Vermont, Massachusetts, Rhode Island, and Connecticut in the U.S., as well as New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island, and Quebec in Canada.
example: The northeastern United States experienced a harsh winter this year, causing numerous traffic accidents on icy roads.

definition: Relating to or situated in the north, or being one of the regions of the world located above the equator.
example: The northern lights are a natural light display that can be seen in the sky primarily in the polar regions during the nighttime.

definition: Northward refers to the direction towards the north pole or moving in that direction.
example: The birds migrate northward during the winter months.

definition: Northwest refers to the general direction that is 315 degrees clockwise from north. It indicates a region or location in this specific direction.
example: The city is located in the northwestern part of the country, bordering the mountains.

definition: Northwestern refers to something that is located or positioned in the northwest region of a larger area, such as a country, continent, or even the world. The term can also describe directions or points within this region.
example: The northwestern states of the U.S., including Washington and Oregon, are known for their beautiful landscapes and mild climate.

definition: The nose is a part of the face that is located in the center between the eyes and the mouth. It serves several functions, including smelling (olfaction) and breathing (respiration).
example: "I rubbed my nose after I sneezed."

definition: Nostrils are the two openings in the human nose through which air enters and leaves the body. They serve as passageways for breathing.
example: "I can feel a cold coming on, I think I'll apply some Vicks VapoRub to my nostrils."

definition: "Not" is a common logical negation in English, used to express the opposite or negation of a statement. It often appears before a word or phrase to change its meaning from affirmative to negative.
example: "I am studying." (Affirmative statement) becomes "I am not studying." (Negative statement with 'not').

definition: A note is a written or spoken message intended to serve as a reminder, explanation, or symbol. It can also be a short piece of music that the singer or instrumentalist sings or plays.
example: When grocery shopping, jot down notes about items you need to buy on your phone so you don't forget them later.

definition: A notebook is a bound book, usually with lined or unlined pages, used primarily for writing, sketching, recording data, or taking notes.
example: "I always carry a notebook in my bag to jot down ideas when they come to me during the day."

definition: The state or fact of having no quality, quantity, substance, or meaning; absolute absence.
example: I found nothing interesting in the book.

definition: To become aware of or perceive something, often due to it being made deliberately conspicuous. It can also refer to a formal document or announcement about a matter of importance.
example: She noticed the stranger at the coffee shop who kept staring at her.

definition: Noticeable refers to something that is easily perceived, visible, or striking. It denotes a quality or change that stands out and can be observed or detected.
example: The yellow flowers in the garden were quite noticeable against the green bushes.

definition: A noticeboard is a publicly accessible board where information, notices, or announcements are posted for people to see.
example: There was an important notice about the upcoming school event posted on the noticeboard in the hallway.

definition: A notion is an idea, belief, or theory that has not been conclusively proven but is accepted as plausible based on current knowledge or understanding.
example: The scientist's initial notion about the existence of dark matter was met with skepticism until it could be empirically verified through further research.

definition: Known or famous, often in an unfavorable or disreputable way.
example: The pirate Blackbeard was notorious for his ruthless behavior at sea.

definition: Nought is another term for zero or nothing. It's less commonly used in modern English, but it can be found in certain phrases like "nought to choose from" meaning there is no option or possibility available.
example: In the game of chess, if a piece is removed from the board, its square is marked with 'â™”' or 'â™š', and sometimes with 'o' or 'naught'. So, if the queen was taken off the board, you might see 'â™• x naught' on that square to indicate it is no longer in play.

definition: A noun is a word that represents a person, place, thing, or idea. It can function as the subject of a verb, the object of a verb, or the complement of a linking verb in a sentence.
example: The cat (noun) sat on the mat (noun). In this sentence, "cat" and "mat" are both nouns; one is the subject ("cat") and the other is the object ("mat").

definition: To provide with nutrients essential for growth, health, or well-being.
example: She nourished the seedling by watering it every day.

definition: The act or process of providing or maintaining life by eating food; sustenance, food, or nutrition.
example: After a long hike, she was in desperate need of some nourishment and gratefully accepted the energy bar offered by her friend.

definition: A novel is a long fictional narrative, typically published as a book, consisting of prose and presented in several chapters. It usually tells an imaginative, entertaining, or educational story about individuals or groups, exploring their psychology, relationships, motivations, and actions in a particular setting.
example: Jane Austen's "Pride and Prejudice" is a popular novel that follows the romantic relationship between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy while examining societal norms of 19th-century England.

definition: A novelist is an author who writes novels, which are lengthy fictional narratives typically dealing with imaginary events and characters.
example: Emily BrontÃ« was a renowned 19th-century English novelist known for her masterpiece "Wuthering Heights."

definition: Novelty refers to something new, unusual, or original, especially something that is not familiar or commonplace. It often has an element of surprise and captures attention due to its uniqueness.
example: The antique shop owner was thrilled when a customer brought in a rare, 18th-century pocket watch - the novelty of such an item was both exciting and profitable.

definition: November is the eleventh month of the year in the Julian and Gregorian calendars, with 30 days in most years and 29 days in a leap year.
example: "It's getting colder outside; we need to bring out our winter coats in November."

definition: "Now" refers to the present moment or time.
example: "Can you please pass me the book now?" (This sentence indicates that the speaker wants the action to happen immediately, meaning in the current moment.)

definition: Nowadays refers to the present time, particularly indicating recent or current trends or practices. It implies a modern or contemporary context.
example: Nowadays, most people prefer online banking over traditional branch visits due to its convenience and speed.

definition: Nowhere refers to a place that does not exist or cannot be found. It is used to denote lack of location or absence of a specific place.
example: I've looked everywhere, but I can't find my keys; they seem to be nowhere.

definition: Nuclear refers to the use of atomic energy, particularly in relation to the unstable and highly energetic particles inside an atom's nucleus. It is often associated with nuclear power generation or nuclear weapons.
example: The country announced plans to build a new nuclear power plant to reduce its reliance on fossil fuels.

definition: The nucleus is the central part of a cell that contains most of its genetic material, DNA. It is surrounded by a membrane called the nuclear envelope.
example: In every cell, the nucleus serves as a control center, directing the activities of the cell's contents and carrying genes that determine the cell's characteristics. For example, in a typical animal cell, the nucleus contains 46 chromosomes during the interphase stage.

definition: A nuisance is an annoying or harmful thing, person, or activity that unreasonably interferes with the comfort, health, or peace of others.
example: The constant barking of his neighbor's dog at all hours of the day and night became a real nuisance for John.

definition: A number is a mathematical value that can be used to count, measure, or label items or quantities. It is a member of a set of symbols that we use to represent quantities in mathematics and everyday life.
example: There are three apples on the table. The number 3 represents the quantity of apples in this example.

definition: Relating to or involving numbers or quantities that can be counted.
example: The numerical value of each team's points determines the winner in a competition.

definition: A large or very great number of things.
example: The researcher collected numerous data samples for analysis.

definition: A nurse is a licensed medical professional who provides care, comfort, and support to individuals who are sick, injured, or require specialized care. They often work in hospitals, clinics, or private homes.
example: The nurse carefully monitored the patient's vital signs and administered medication as prescribed by the doctor.

definition: A nursery is a place where plants, especially young ones, are grown and cared for before they are large enough to be transplanted or sold. It may also refer to a room in a house where babies and very young children are looked after while their parents are not present.
example: The child's mother left him at the nursery for a few hours while she ran some errands. (Childcare nursery)

definition: A nut is a hard-shelled fruit that encloses one or more seeds. Nuts are edible and often used in cooking or eating raw.
example: She spread peanut butter on a slice of bread for her morning sandwich.

definition: A nutrient is a substance that organisms require in small amounts to sustain life and growth, typically found in food. These substances include proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, and minerals.
example: The salad contains essential nutrients such as vitamins A, C, iron, and calcium which are necessary for our body's growth and overall health.

definition: Nutrition refers to the process of providing or obtaining the food necessary for growth, maintenance, and reproduction in an organism. It involves the intake and utilization of essential elements such as proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, and minerals from food.
example: Eating a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and whole grains ensures proper nutrition for a healthy lifestyle. For instance, consuming an apple, a piece of chicken, a slice of whole-grain bread, and a side of steamed broccoli can provide essential nutrients for the body.

definition: Nutritious refers to food that provides necessary nutrients for the growth, repair, and maintenance of an organism's body. These nutrients include proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, and minerals.
example: The salad with spinach, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and grilled chicken breast is a very nutritious meal option for lunch.

definition: A nutshell is a brief or compact summary of an explanation, argument, or idea.
example: I'll give you the main points in a nutshell: The story is about a detective solving a mysterious case by finding clues hidden throughout the city.

definition: Oak is a genus of trees or shrubs belonging to the family of Beech (Fagaceae), known for their hard and durable wood. The oak's leaves have lobes and are usually deciduous.
example: Last fall, we collected acorns from the mighty oak tree in our backyard to plant new trees next spring.

definition: A solemn promise or declaration, often made by swearing to tell the truth or to fulfill a duty, and typically invoking a deity or something regarded as sacred.
example: "I swear to uphold the Constitution of this country and execute my duties faithfully and impartially."

definition: Obedience is the act of complying with a command, instruction, or rule given by someone who has authority over you.
example: The dog showed obedience when it fetched the ball after its owner threw it.

definition: Obedient refers to someone or something that complies with commands, wishes, or laws without question or resistance.
example: The dog was obedient and followed its trainer's instructions immediately during the agility competition.

definition: To obey means to follow a command, law, or rule given by someone who has authority. It refers to compliance with an order or instruction.
example: The children must obey their parents and clean up their toys before dinner.

definition: An obituary is a newspaper notice that reports on a person's death, typically includes biographical details of the deceased and information about the funeral or memorial service.
example: "The local newspaper published an obituary for John Doe, who passed away at the age of 85. It mentioned his career as a teacher, his love for gardening, and his surviving family members."

definition: An object is a physical entity that can be seen and touched, or something abstract that is represented by a concrete symbol. It may have a name, description, and properties such as color, size, shape, etc.
example: The red ball on the table is an object with specific characteristics like being round in shape, red in color, and of substantial size.

definition: An objection is an expression of disagreement, disapproval, or dissent regarding a statement, action, or proposition. It is typically raised to challenge the validity, legality, fairness, or appropriateness of something.
example: "Counsel objected to the introduction of this piece of evidence as it was not properly authenticated."

definition: An objective is a clearly defined goal or aim that one intends to achieve, typically one that is set in a systematic manner and often within a given time frame. Objectives are usually unbiased, factual, and measurable.
example: The objective of the research project is to reduce the mortality rate of cardiac patients by 20% within the next two years.

definition: Obligation refers to a sense of moral or contractual duty to perform a certain action, often based on principles of honor, law, or responsibility.
example: "John felt an obligation to help his elderly neighbor with her groceries because he knew she lived alone and had difficulty moving around."

definition: Observation is the act of making notes or taking notice about something or someone, usually based on careful watching.
example: The scientist made an observation of the plant's growth pattern over a period of months.

definition: To watch or notice carefully, typically over a period of time. It may also imply to comply with or conform to (a law, custom, etc.).
example: The biologist observed the behavior of the endangered species for a week before making any conclusions about their habitat.

definition: An observer is a person or entity that watches, monitors, or studies something or someone.
example: The astronaut was an observer on the International Space Station, recording data about Earth's climate for researchers back on Earth.

definition: To obsess means to think about something constantly or compulsively, often to an excessive degree. It can also refer to the state of being excessively preoccupied with someone or something.
example: John has been obsessed with solving the Rubik's cube for weeks now, spending hours each day trying to figure it out.

definition: Obsession refers to an intense and persistent preoccupation or idea that dominates one's thoughts. It often involves a fixation or compulsion, sometimes to the point of interfering with everyday life.
example: John's obsession with classic cars led him to restore more than 50 vintage vehicles in his garage, which left little room for anything else in his life.

definition: Obsessive refers to someone who has an uncontrollable and disproportionate preoccupation with or fixation on a particular idea, object, or action.
example: John is obsessive about cleanliness; he washes his hands for 10 minutes every time before eating.

definition: An obstacle is something that makes progress difficult or impossible by causing problems or blocking the way. It could be a physical barrier, challenge, difficulty, or any hindrance in achieving an objective.
example: The broken bridge was an obstacle preventing the firefighters from reaching the burning building quickly.

definition: To get or acquire something, especially after effort.
example: The student obtained a scholarship to study abroad.

definition: Obvious refers to something that is easily seen, recognized, or understood; it's clear and apparent without needing much explanation.
example: "The answer was obvious once we realized the question was a trick."

definition: Clearly evident or apparent to the mind; easily understood.
example: "It's obvious that she is very intelligent."

definition: An occasion is a specific time or event, often associated with celebration, significance, or a particular purpose.
example: "They decided to throw a party on the occasion of their graduation."

definition: Occasional refers to something that happens or is done on special or irregular occasions, rather than regularly or habitually.
example: She attends the book club meeting occasionaly when her schedule allows it.

definition: Occasionally refers to happening or occurring not regularly but at times, on specific events or circumstances.
example: I occasionally visit my grandparents during holidays.

definition: Occupation refers to a person's main job, profession, or trade. It is what someone does regularly to earn a living.
example: His occupation is a software engineer at Google.

definition: To take or hold possession of a place, typically one that is already someone else's property, often in a way that expresses protest or resistance.
example: Protesters occupied the city hall to demand better public services.

definition: To happen or take place, especially unexpectedly or by chance.
example: "An unexpected storm occurred while we were hiking in the mountains."

definition: A large body of saltwater that covers most of the Earth's surface and is divided into several principal parts, such as the Atlantic, Pacific, Indian, Arctic, and Southern (Antarctic) Oceans.
example: The Great Barrier Reef, located in the Coral Sea off the coast of Australia, is the world's largest coral reef system and stretches over an ocean area of approximately 143,000 square miles.

definition: "O'clock" is a term used to denote hours on a clock or watch, particularly whole hours. It is often used in conjunction with the numbers 1 through 12 on a traditional 12-hour clock.
example: I will meet you at 3 o'clock this afternoon.

definition: October is the tenth month of the year in the Gregorian calendar, lasting from October 1st to October 31st. It is usually considered a part of autumn or fall in the Northern Hemisphere and spring in the Southern Hemisphere.
example: The leaves on the trees started changing colors in October.

definition: Unusual, irregular, or not divisible by two without remainder. In a less technical sense, it can mean peculiar, strange, or unexpected.
example: The number of legs on a spider is odd (seven).

definition: The preposition "of" is used to show a relationship between two nouns or pronouns, indicating possession, origin, source, or separation. It can also be used to indicate time, quantity, or purpose.
example: The cat's fur is soft of grey and white. (Here, "of" indicates the color and pattern of the cat's fur.)

definition: To be or located away from a point of reference, usually horizontally; to cease activity or operation.
example: The office is closed for the weekend, so I won't be able to go there off until Monday.

definition: To cause annoyance, anger, or upset to someone, usually because of something one says or does that is considered rude, disrespectful, or inappropriate.
example: His joke about religion offended many people at the party.

definition: A person who has committed an offense or violated a law or rule.
example: The offender was arrested for committing a burglary in the neighborhood last night.

definition: An offense is an action or behavior that breaks a law or rule, and is considered objectionable or disturbing. It can refer to both criminal offenses and breaches of etiquette or ethics.
example: "John was charged with speeding, which is a traffic offense in this town."

definition: Offensive refers to something that is considered rude, disrespectful, or causing annoyance, anger, or resentment. It can also refer to an attack or a series of attacks launched by one group against another.
example: The coach's offensive comments about the opposing team were highly inappropriate and led to a heated argument during the match.

definition: A proposal made to someone, inviting them to accept a product, service, or action. It is often made with the expectation that it will be accepted.
example: The restaurant manager offered us a complimentary dessert as an apology for the long wait.

definition: Offhand refers to something said or done casually, without much thought or preparation, or in a way that is not planned or formal. It can also mean something given away without charge.
example: "When asked about the party details, he gave an offhand reply that they would decide later."

definition: An office is a room or building where administrative work is done, typically by government officials or business employees.
example: John works in an office building downtown as a software engineer.

definition: An officer is a person who holds a position of authority, especially within an organization or institution, often in a role such as law enforcement, military, or government. They are responsible for enforcing rules and maintaining order.
example: "The police officer directed traffic at the busy intersection during rush hour."

definition: An official is a person who is recognized as having the legal authority to act for a government or organization. They are typically assigned or elected to a position of trust and are responsible for specific duties.
example: The mayor is the official in charge of a city, responsible for making important decisions about its governance.

definition: Officially refers to something being done, recognized, or authorized according to established rules, regulations, or procedures, often with a legal or formal context.
example: The new president was officially sworn into office during the inauguration ceremony.

definition: Offshore refers to activities, companies, or installations located beyond the territorial limits of a nation's jurisdiction in international waters.
example: The oil rig operated by XYZ Corporation is an offshore platform located 120 miles from the coast.

definition: Frequently or habitually; many times.
example: She often goes jogging in the park early in the morning.

definition: Oil is a liquid that is typically obtained from plants, animals, or mineral sources and is used for various purposes such as fuel, lubrication, cooking, and manufacturing.
example: She poured olive oil onto the salad before serving it at dinner.

definition: Oily refers to something that is covered with oil, greasy, or has a slippery texture due to the presence of oil.
example: After frying the potatoes, they became very oily and needed to be blotted with paper towels.

definition: An ointment is a semi-solid preparation, usually greasy or waxy, used for the topical treatment of skin conditions, wounds, or other ailments. It's often made with a base, such as petroleum jelly, and medicinal ingredients like antibiotics, pain relievers, or anti-inflammatories.
example: After burning herself while cooking, she applied an ointment to soothe the pain and prevent infection.

definition: An informal way to say that something is all right, satisfactory, or acceptable. It can also be used to agree or to acknowledge understanding.
example: "I understand your point, okay?"

definition: Old refers to something that is not new or recent, often having a long history or age.
example: The old bridge over the river has been there since the 1800s.

definition: Old-fashioned refers to something that is traditional, outdated, or no longer modern in style or practice.
example: She prefers old-fashioned letter writing with a fountain pen instead of emailing.

definition: Olive is a small, rounded fruit that grows on the olive tree, typically used in cooking for its oil or as a pickled vegetable.
example: I'm adding some sliced olives to my salad for extra flavor.

definition: Olive oil is a liquid fat obtained from olives, typically used in cooking and cosmetics. It's rich in monounsaturated fats and has a distinct taste.
example: She drizzled some olive oil over the salad before serving it for dinner.

definition: Olympia is the capital city of the U.S. state of Washington and was named after Mount Olympus in Greece, the home of the ancient Greek gods. It serves as a cultural hub for the region with its museums, universities, and annual festivals.
example: Each summer, Olympia hosts the renowned Washington State Fair, attracting thousands of visitors who come to enjoy food, music, and agricultural exhibits.

definition: An Olympiad is a large international sports competition, most notably the Summer and Winter Olympic Games held every four years. It can also refer to other international competitions in various academic fields such as mathematics, physics, chemistry, or computer science.
example: Every four years, athletes from around the world gather for the Summer Olympics to compete in a variety of sports. In addition, bright students from across the globe participate in the International Mathematical Olympiad to test their problem-solving skills.

definition: The Olympic Games are a major international multi-sport event, held every four years among athletes from various countries. They were inspired by the ancient Greek Olympics and revived in modern times in 1896.
example: This year, athletes from all over the world will compete in the Summer Olympic Games held in Tokyo, Japan.

definition: The Olympics is a global sporting event, held every four years in summer and winter, featuring numerous competitive sports. It is considered the highest level of achievement in athletics.
example: "The 2020 Tokyo Olympics opened on July 23rd, bringing together athletes from around the world to compete in various sports."

definition: An omelet or omlette is a dish made by frying beaten eggs with other ingredients, such as cheese, vegetables, or meat, usually folded over. It can be served for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.
example: She prepared a delicious omelette with bell peppers, onions, and cheddar cheese for breakfast.

definition: The preposition "on" denotes a relationship where something is, occurs, or is supported above another thing. It can also indicate the time at which an action occurs.
example: "The book is on the table." In this sentence, "on" indicates that the book is positioned above the table. Another example with the temporal use of "on": "I will see you on Monday." Here, "on" indicates the specific day and time when the meeting will take place.

definition: Once refers to a past time or event that has already happened. It implies a single occurrence in the past and is often used to indicate that something no longer continues.
example: I once had a pet turtle named Timmy, but he ran away during a storm.

definition: A number that represents a single count or item, often denoted by '1'. It is the smallest positive integer.
example: "There is one apple on the table."

definition: Refers to oneself or one's own being, used as the subject of a verb.
example: "She took care of herself during her illness."

definition: An onion is a vegetable with numerous layers of tender flesh enclosing a central bulb. It has a pungent taste that becomes stronger when the onion is cut or crushed.
example: I chopped an onion to add flavor to my spaghetti sauce.

definition: The term "online" refers to a state of connection to a computer network, typically the internet, allowing real-time interaction and access to resources from any location.
example: John spends most of his free time playing video games online with friends who live far away.

definition: The adverb "only" is used to indicate that something is the sole, single, or complete instance of a thing, excluding any others, or limiting something to a particular degree or extent.
example: I will eat an apple only if it is organic. (This sentence means that the person will not eat apples unless they are organic.)

definition: The term "onstage" refers to any location or area where a performance, show, or presentation is taking place. It is the part of a theater or stage that is visible to the audience during a live event.
example: The actress confidently walked onstage and began her monologue as the spotlight illuminated her.

definition: "Onto" is a preposition that means moving or causing something to move onto a surface, especially one where it can be placed. It's often used to indicate the destination or goal of an action or movement. However, it's important to note that "onto" is not commonly used in formal written English, and its usage is more common in informal or spoken English.
example: The cat jumped onto the table. In this sentence, the cat moved or was placed on top of the table.

definition: To make (something) accessible or free from obstructions; to have no barrier or restriction.
example: "The door was open, so she walked right in."

definition: An opening is an act or occasion of beginning, starting, or commencing something; it can also refer to a gap, space, or entrance.
example: "The ceremony began with the official opening of the new library."

definition: Openly means in a clear, straightforward, or unconcealed manner, often without trying to hide or keep something secret. It can also mean without pretense or disguise.
example: John openly expressed his love for Mary at the party, making it obvious to everyone present.

definition: Opera is a form of performing arts that combines singing, orchestral music, acting, and stagecraft to present a story based on a libretto. It originated in Italy during the late Renaissance (16th century).
example: She was mesmerized by the beautiful voice of the lead singer in "La BohÃ¨me," an iconic opera composed by Giacomo Puccini.

definition: To operate means to work or function, especially in a systematic or regular way. It can also refer to controlling or managing something, like a machine or business.
example: The surgeon will operate on the patient at 8 am tomorrow. The factory operates three shifts a day.

definition: An operation is a procedure or a series of steps carried out in a calculated and systematic way to achieve an objective. It often involves the use of tools, instruments, or machinery, and can be applied to various fields such as mathematics, medicine, engineering, or business.
example: The surgeon performed a successful operation on the patient's knee to replace the damaged cartilage.

definition: An operator is a mathematical symbol or function that tells us how to perform calculations on numbers or expressions. It acts upon an operand (or operands) to produce a result.
example: In the equation 5 + 3, '+' is the operator and the operands are 5 and 3. The operation performed is addition, resulting in 8 as the answer.

definition: A belief or judgment that is not necessarily based on fact or knowledge but rather on a person's feelings, tastes, and perceptions.
example: "Everyone has their own opinion about the best pizza in town, but I think Joe's Pizzeria takes the cake."

definition: A person or thing that is in opposition or competition with another; an adversary or competitor.
example: In the tennis match, John was playing against Maria as opponents.

definition: An opportunity is a situation or condition that makes it possible to do something, especially something beneficial.
example: "The job interview was an excellent opportunity for her to showcase her skills."

definition: To oppose means to be against or in opposition to something, usually with an intention to prevent it from happening or being successful. It can also refer to expressing disagreement or resistance.
example: The community opposes the construction of a new factory due to environmental concerns.

definition: Opposite refers to something that is directly contrary to another in nature, quality, or effect.
example: The opposite of a positive number is a negative number. For example, the opposite of 5 is -5.

definition: Opposition refers to the act, force, or fact of being opposed, as in opposing someone's ideas, policies, or actions. It is a group that formally contests and seeks to overturn an established government or political leader, or it can simply be two conflicting views or forces.
example: The Democratic party often serves as the opposition to Republican policies in the United States.

definition: To dominate, burden, or restrict someone (usually a group or class) cruelly or unjustly, typically by exerting control over them. This can involve depriving them of their civil rights, freedom, or access to resources.
example: The ruling class oppressed the working class for many years, denying them fair wages and basic human rights.

definition: Oppression refers to the unjust or cruel exercise of authority or power over someone, typically by a systemic means, leading to the subjugation, marginalization, or discrimination of a group of people. It involves the systematic denial of rights and freedoms to certain groups based on factors like race, gender, religion, etc.
example: The indigenous community in this country has faced oppression for centuries, with limited access to education, healthcare, and political representation.

definition: Optimism is a positive attitude that assumes the best possible outcome will occur or is more likely than not to occur. It's expecting good things to happen, even in adverse situations.
example: Despite facing numerous obstacles, she maintained an optimistic outlook and eventually achieved her dream of becoming a doctor.

definition: An optimist is an individual who expects or assumes that things will turn out for the best, often remaining hopeful and positive even in adverse circumstances.
example: Despite the challenging economic climate, Jane remained an optimist, believing that her business would prosper soon.

definition: Optimistic refers to the attitude or disposition that is hopeful and confident about the future or a favorable outcome.
example: "Despite the challenging economic situation, she remained optimistic about finding a good job."

definition: An option is a contract that gives the buyer the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell an asset at a specified price (strike price) within a certain time frame.
example: "Investors often purchase call options on stocks they believe will increase in value, giving them the ability to profit from the rising stock price without having to initially invest heavily."

definition: Optional refers to something that is not essential or compulsory, but can be chosen or done at will. It implies that there are alternatives available and the decision to use them rests upon the individual.
example: Participating in a yoga class after work is optional; you could also choose to go home immediately if you prefer.

definition: "Or" is a coordinating conjunction that joins two or more words, phrases, or clauses in a sentence to suggest alternatives.
example: You can either study at home or go to the library for quieter space.

definition: Pertaining to the mouth or speech, or delivered orally rather than in writing.
example: The dentist performed an oral examination on the patient.

definition: Orange is a citrus fruit characterized by its tangy flavor, bright orange color, and juicy segments inside. It is also the name for the corresponding hue.
example: I prefer drinking freshly squeezed orange juice in the morning. The sunset today was as beautiful as an orange.

definition: An orator is an individual who uses persuasive language effectively in public speaking, often in a formal setting such as a speech or debate.
example: Martin Luther King Jr. was a renowned orator, inspiring millions with his powerful speeches like the "I Have a Dream" speech during the Civil Rights Movement.

definition: Orbit refers to the path that an object follows around another gravitational body, such as a planet or star.
example: The International Space Station orbits Earth at an altitude of approximately 408 kilometers.

definition: An orchestra is a large instrumental ensemble that typically includes string, brass, woodwind, and percussion sections. It is conducted by a music director and performs symphonic music and other types of classical, popular, or jazz music.
example: The Philadelphia Orchestra is one of the oldest and most respected orchestras in the United States.

definition: Relating to an orchestra or its music. An ensemble of musicians playing instrumental music together, typically in a classical setting.
example: The symphony was a breathtaking orchestral piece that showcased the depth and richness of the various instruments.

definition: An orchid is a type of flower that belongs to the Orchidaceae family, known for their diversity, beauty, and often exotic nature. They are distinguished by their roots, stems, and leaves, which can be simple or highly modified in different species.
example: "The vibrant purple orchids growing in the rainforest were a breathtaking sight."

definition: A command or request given to do something, especially one given by an authority figure. Also refers to a systematic arrangement or sequence.
example: "The customer placed an order for a pizza with pepperoni and extra cheese."

definition: Orderly refers to something or someone that is organized, methodical, and arranged in a systematic manner. It can also describe a person who behaves in an orderly way, following rules and being well-mannered.
example: The library was an orderly place with all the books neatly arranged on shelves according to their subjects.

definition: Ordinary refers to something that is common, usual, or not remarkable or extraordinary.
example: John leads an ordinary life, going to work every day and coming home in the evening.

definition: An organ is a part of an animal's body that performs a specific function in the body system, typically containing specialized cells or tissues and often enclosed within a protective casing.
example: The heart is one of the most important organs in our body; it pumps blood throughout our circulatory system.

definition: Organic refers to something that is produced or involving production without the use of synthetic (artificial) fertilizers, pesticides, or other artificial agents. It can also refer to a substance found in living organisms. In a broader sense, it's often used to describe products that are natural or coming from a natural source.
example: The farmer grows organic vegetables, which means they don't use any synthetic fertilizers or pesticides.

definition: An organism is any living entity characterized by structure and function, typically consisting of one cell (unicellular) or many cells (multicellular), such as bacteria, animals, plants, and fungi.
example: The caterpillar is an organism that transforms into a butterfly during metamorphosis.

definition: An organization is a structured group of people who come together to achieve a shared goal, mission, or set of objectives. It can be a business, non-profit, government agency, or any other type of formal entity.
example: "The United Nations is an international organization that aims to maintain peace and security, promote human rights, and foster sustainable development around the world."

definition: To arrange or structure something in a systematic manner, usually with the goal of making it more efficient and effective. This can involve grouping similar items, creating schedules, or establishing hierarchies.
example: "John is organizing a charity event next month, so he's making a list of potential volunteers and tasks to ensure everything runs smoothly."

definition: Organized or Organised refers to something that is methodical, orderly, and well-arranged, especially in a systematic way. It implies having a plan or structure and being able to carry out tasks efficiently and effectively.
example: John was praised by his boss for the organized manner in which he presented the project proposal, with each section clearly defined and easy to follow.

definition: An organizer or organisier is a person who arranges things in a systematic manner, often coordinating events, activities, or tasks. It can also refer to a tool or device used for organizing and storing items.
example: Jane is an excellent organiser, she always manages to plan and execute successful events without any chaos. Last weekend's charity auction was a great example of her organisational skills.

definition: Origin refers to the place, source, or starting point from which something arises or is derived.
example: The origin of the Nile River can be traced back to Lake Victoria in East Africa.

definition: Original refers to something that is first in its kind, unique, or not a copy. It denotes the primary source from which copies are made or something that has never been done before.
example: The architect's design for the museum was original and captivated everyone's attention at the architectural conference.

definition: Originality refers to the quality of being new, unusual, or unusually creative. It's about having a fresh, independent, and imaginative idea rather than copying or imitating others.
example: The artist is known for his originality, as he paints abstract landscapes that are quite unlike anything else in the art world.

definition: Originally refers to something's initial source or place where it began.
example: The painting was originally created in the 17th century, but its authenticity has been questioned by modern art historians.

definition: To begin or come into being; to have a source or origin.
example: The company originate in California and has expanded to several other states.

definition: Ornament is any decorative item, design, or pattern added to something, such as a building, piece of furniture, clothing, or artwork, for aesthetic appeal.
example: The gold leaf was carefully applied to the church's intricate ornaments during the annual restoration process.

definition: An orphan is a person who has lost both parents, usually through death.
example: The child was left an orphan when his father and mother died in a car accident.

definition: Other refers to any person, thing, or group that is not specifically named, specified, or already considered in a particular context. It usually implies more than one entity.
example: When I asked my friend if she wanted to go to the movies with me, and she invited another person as well, I said, "That's fine, but who is this other person?" This implies that I do not know or am not aware of the identity of the second individual.

definition: Otherwise refers to a situation or condition that would occur if something different from what is being proposed, expected, or currently happening were to happen. It is used to suggest an alternative consequence or outcome.
example: If you don't study for the exam, otherwise, you might fail.

definition: "Ought to" is a modal verb used to express obligation, duty, or what is considered appropriate in a situation. It suggests that something is expected or required due to reasons such as morality, logic, or custom.
example: "You ought to take an umbrella with you today; it's going to rain heavily." In this example, the speaker suggests that the listener has a duty or obligation (to take an umbrella) because of the expected rain.

definition: An ounce is a unit of weight or mass, traditionally used in the imperial and United States customary systems. In the US customary system, it is equal to approximately 28.35 grams.
example: She weighed herself and found she had lost three ounces since her last visit.

definition: The pronoun "our" refers to something that belongs or is associated with the speaker and one or more people they are addressing, typically within a group.
example: "Our team will work together on this project."

definition: Belonging to us or our group, something that we own or share.
example: "These books are ours; we need to return them to the library by next week."

definition: Refers to oneself, or oneself collectively when in a group. It is a reflexive pronoun used as the subject of a verb.
example: "We should take care of ourselves during these challenging times."

definition: The term "out" is an adverb that generally means 'beyond the normal or usual limits or bounds' or 'from a confined place'. It can also function as a preposition to indicate position away from something, or as an exclamation expressing surprise or dismay.
example: The ball rolled out of the yard. (The ball went beyond the boundaries of the yard.)

definition: "Out of" is a preposition that indicates a removal from within or a lack due to removal. It can also mean not in the expected or normal place, or outside something.
example: I am out of coffee, so I need to go buy some more. (In this context, "out of" means there is no more coffee left.)

definition: The outback refers to the remote, sparsely populated regions in the interior of a country, especially Australia. It is often characterized by vast open plains, desert landscapes, and rugged terrain.
example: John decided to take a road trip across the outback for an authentic Australian adventure.

definition: An outbreak is a sudden, rapid, and intense increase in the number of cases of a disease or infection within a given population or geographic area. It often refers to situations that demand immediate attention due to their potential for widespread contagion.
example: "The small town experienced an outbreak of food poisoning after consuming contaminated water from the local well."

definition: The result or consequence of something that happens or is done.
example: After weeks of hard work, the team's outcome was a successful project launch.

definition: To outdistance someone means to move ahead of them in a competition, race, or journey, usually by having superior speed, skill, or ability. It can also mean to surpass someone in terms of time, distance, or achievement.
example: In the 100-meter dash, Usain Bolt managed to outdistance his opponents, finishing the race more than a second ahead of the second-place runner.

definition: To outdo someone means to excel or surpass them in an activity, achievement, or quality. It implies going beyond what they have done or possessing a higher degree of something.
example: In the school science fair, Sarah worked tirelessly on her project and managed to outdo all her classmates with her innovative design.

definition: Outdoor refers to any space or environment that is not enclosed by a building or structure, primarily open to the elements and typically used for recreation or activities.
example: "Let's have our picnic lunch in the outdoor park area."

definition: The outdoors refers to all areas outside of buildings or vehicles, such as parks, forests, beaches, and backyards. It is primarily the natural environment, contrasting with indoor spaces.
example: "Let's go for a picnic in the outdoors tomorrow afternoon."

definition: Outer refers to something that is on the outside, external, or farthest from a center or point of reference.
example: The outer layer of the onion is tough and needs to be peeled off.

definition: An outfit refers to a complete set of clothing that is worn together, including shoes and accessories. It can also refer to the entire physical appearance or equipment of something.
example: She chose a stylish red dress and matching heels for her friend's wedding - it was her favorite outfit.

definition: To outgrow means to become too large, old, or sophisticated for something that was once appropriate or suitable. It can also mean to develop beyond the requirements of a particular situation or environment.
example: As she grew older, Sarah found that her clothes no longer fit; she had outgrown them.

definition: The act of revealing someone's secret, especially that they are LGBTQ+, without their consent. It can also refer more broadly to any situation where a person's private information is exposed against their will.
example: John was outed by his ex-partner at the company meeting, causing a lot of distress and awkwardness among colleagues who didn't know he was gay.

definition: An outlaw is a person who operates outside of the law, usually because they have disregarded its rules or have been banished from it. They are typically associated with criminal activities.
example: The infamous Jesse James was an outlaw in the Wild West, robbing banks and trains during his career as a bandit.

definition: An outlet is a socket or opening that allows electrical current to be taken from an electrical source, typically for powering appliances or devices. It usually consists of one or more slots where a plug can be inserted.
example: I need to charge my phone, could you please show me where the nearest outlet is in this room?

definition: An outline is a structured summary or plan that provides an overview of a complex subject, typically used to organize and present information clearly.
example: "Before writing her essay on global warming, Jane created an outline to ensure she included all the main points such as causes, effects, solutions, and conclusions."

definition: To live longer than someone or something else, or to continue to exist beyond a predicted or expected end.
example: She outlived her husband by fifteen years. The oak tree outlived several generations of the family who planted it.

definition: Outlook refers to one's attitude, perspective, or expectation regarding the future. It can also refer to a software system that provides email, calendaring, contacts, and other productivity tools.
Being or feeling not current, modern, or up-to-date.
example: The fashion in that store seems out-of-date compared to what's trending now.

definition: An outpatient is a person who receives medical treatment or diagnosis without requiring an overnight stay at a hospital or healthcare facility. They are free to leave the facility after their visit and do not require hospitalization.
example: Jane went for her regular check-up as an outpatient at the local clinic, which allowed her to return home in the afternoon.

definition: The result or product generated by a machine, process, or system. It is typically the opposite of input.
example: After processing the data, the computer produced an output in the form of a graph.

definition: A strong, angry reaction to what is perceived as an unjust or immoral act or behavior.
example: The public outrage over the government's decision to increase taxes without prior notice was overwhelming.

definition: Extremely shocking, offensive, or beyond what is acceptable or proper.
example: His behavior at the meeting was outrageous; he shouted and stormed out without a proper explanation.

definition: To outshine someone or something means to surpass them in brilliance, brightness, or effectiveness. It is often used when one person or thing exceeds another in a particular aspect.
example: Despite his less experienced team, the coach managed to outshine his competitors by leading them to win three consecutive championship titles.

definition: Outside refers to the space or area that is beyond the inside of a building, room, or any enclosed space. It can also be used to denote anything external to a particular situation, group, or activity.
example: I like to sit outside on the porch during sunset.

definition: A person or group who is not part of a particular social group, organization, or community and stands outside it.
example: John was an outsider at the company because he didn't know anyone and had just started working there.

definition: The outskirts of a town or city refer to its edges, periphery, or suburban areas that are typically less densely populated than the central parts.
example: John lived on the outskirts of the city where it was quieter and less crowded compared to the downtown area.

definition: Exceptional or extremely good; surpassing what is usual or expected.
example: The chef's outstanding culinary skills won him the top prize in the cooking competition.

definition: Outward refers to something that is directed or moving toward the outside; external.
example: The outward appearance of a person can sometimes be deceiving.

definition: Outwardly refers to something that is visible, apparent, or noticeable on the outside; used to describe a situation, behavior, or appearance that seems to be true but may not necessarily represent what is happening internally.
example: Despite her outwardly cheerful demeanor, she was struggling with personal issues inside.

definition: To outweigh means to be greater or more important than something else, especially in terms of weight, importance, or significance. It can also mean to have a stronger influence or effect than other factors.
example: In making her decision, the benefits of attending the conference outweighed the costs.

definition: An oval is a rounded geometric shape that has two opposite sides of equal length and the other four sides of unequal length. It's essentially an elongated circle, not quite round but not quite rectangular either.
example: The oval office in the White House is known for its unique shape.

definition: An oven is a large, container-shaped appliance used for cooking food by surrounding it with hot air. It is typically heated electrically or by gas.
example: She baked a delicious apple pie in the oven for her family's dinner.

definition: To be or go beyond a certain point, level, or limit; to be too much.
example: The temperature has gone over 100 degrees today.

definition: Overall refers to something that covers or encompasses everything, typically used to describe a complete or total state or situation. It can also refer to a one-piece garment with sleeves and no separate parts for the upper and lower body.
example: She wore an overall for gardening work as they are practical and easy to clean.

definition: Throwing someone or something from a vessel, especially a boat, usually unintentionally. Also refers to going beyond acceptable limits or expectations.
example: The student was overzealous with her research and ended up working too many hours, which affected her health. (Figuratively)

definition: To overbook means to schedule or reserve more customers, guests, or attendees than there are available spaces or accommodations.
example: The hotel accidentally overbooked and didn't have a room for the guest who arrived first.

definition: An overcoat is a long, outer coat with sleeves, typically worn to protect against cold and wet weather. It is usually made of heavy fabric like wool or tweed and has a collar.
example: On a freezing winter day, John wore his overcoat to keep warm while walking to work.

definition: To conquer or defeat a difficulty, obstacle, or adversary.
example: Despite the initial challenges, Sarah managed to overcome her fear of public speaking and delivered a successful presentation at work.

definition: To overemphasize is to emphasize something too much, often beyond what is necessary or appropriate.
example: In the presentation, the speaker overemphasized the company's successes, which made it seem like they had never faced any challenges.

definition: To overestimate is to judge or calculate something to be more than it actually is. It's an assessment that exceeds the correct or actual value.
example: John overestimated the amount of time he needed to complete the project and ended up missing the deadline.

definition: To hear (a conversation or other sounds) unintentionally and usually secretly, especially when it is not intended for one's ears.
example: While waiting in line at the coffee shop, John overheard two people discussing their secret plan.

definition: To be extremely happy, filled with great joy or delight.
example: When she heard the news about her promotion, Sarah was overjoyed and couldn't stop smiling.

definition: Overlap refers to the situation where two things, areas, or times partially or completely cover each other.
example: The students' schedules overlap during lunchtime, so they can only meet outside of those hours.

definition: To fail to notice or pay attention to something that is visible, nearby, or important; to disregard.
example: The guard overlooked the small key hidden in the flowerpot.

definition: The term "overly" is used to indicate something is done, felt, or given in an excessive or excessively emphatic way. It suggests that a thing has gone beyond what is necessary or appropriate.
example: She was overly critical of her friend's painting, making the artist feel discouraged.

definition: Occurring or done during the night; taking place while sleeping or from dusk till dawn.
example: "I left my clothes out to dry overnight, and they were completely dry in the morning."

definition: Refers to any lands, countries, or regions beyond one's own national boundaries.
example: "I am planning a trip overseas next summer, perhaps to explore the ancient ruins in Greece."

definition: To overshadow means to be so large, powerful, or important that it makes other things seem unimportant by comparison. It can also mean to loom over or obscure something.
example: The tall skyscraper overshadows the smaller buildings in the cityscape.

definition: Oversize refers to something that is larger than normal or expected in size.
example: The suitcase was oversize, so it couldn't fit into the overhead compartment on the airplane.

definition: To go beyond what is proper, acceptable, or permitted in a particular situation.
example: John overstepped his boundaries by telling his boss that the project was not up to standard during the status meeting.

definition: To overtake means to pass a vehicle or something moving in front of you, usually when it is slower than you. It can also mean to exceed or surpass someone or something in a race, competition, or achievement.
example: In the car race, Driver A managed to overtake Driver B on the final straightaway.

definition: The act or an instance of dethroning or replacing the ruler or government of a country, often by force or rebellion.
example: "The revolution led to the overthrow of the dictator and the establishment of a democratic government."

definition: Overtime refers to hours worked beyond the standard or agreed working hours, typically resulting in additional compensation.
example: Due to the project's tight deadline, John had to work overtime every day last week.

definition: To overturn something means to turn it upside down or to reverse a decision, law, or situation. It can also mean to nullify or overthrow.
example: The court overturned the previous ruling in the case, deciding in favor of the defendant.

definition: Being overweight refers to having excess body weight, particularly due to an excessive amount of body fat. It is often determined by comparing a person's actual weight with what is considered healthy or normal for their height and age.
example: "John has been advised by his doctor to lose some weight as he is currently overweight."

definition: To overwhelm means to fill or cover completely, especially in such a way that one is unable to cope with the amount, extent, or force of something. It can also mean to deeply affect or impress someone very strongly, often negatively.
example: The task assignment at work overwhelmed John, as he had never faced anything so complicated before. He struggled to meet the deadline.

definition: Overwhelming refers to an experience or sensation that is extremely strong, powerful, or massive and leaves one feeling overwhelmed, overpowered, or unable to cope.
example: The crowd's cheers were overwhelming during the championship game, leaving some players feeling anxious and intimidated.

definition: Working too much or beyond one's normal or expected working hours, often resulting in exhaustion.
example: "After months of overwork, John finally took a week off to rest and recharge."

definition: "Ow" is an interjection used to express pain or discomfort. It's often exclaimed without warning when one experiences physical harm, like a burn, cut, or bump.
example: "I accidentally touched the hot stove! Ow!"

definition: To owe means to be indebted or obligated, often financially, to someone else. It implies a duty or liability to repay something of value.
example: "I owe you $20 for the movie tickets last night."

definition: Owing refers to a debt or obligation that one person has towards another, often implying an expectation of repayment.
example: John owes Mary $50 because he borrowed the money for groceries last week.

definition: Owing to is a preposition that means because of, due to, or on account of. It is often used to indicate the reason for something.
example: I couldn't attend the meeting owing to an unexpected family emergency.

definition: An owl is a type of bird known for its nocturnal habits, round face, and large, forward-facing eyes. They are typically characterized by their hooting sounds.
example: The wise old owl hooted softly as it surveyed the moonlit forest from its perch.

definition: To own something means to have legal possession of it, usually accompanied by the right to use, control, and dispose of it as one wishes. It can also mean to have a feeling of pride or attachment towards something.
example: I own a house in the suburbs and I love my pet dog, Max. He is truly a part of our family.

definition: An owner is an individual or entity that has legal possession, control, and right to use or dispose of a particular property.
example: Jane is the owner of a beautiful Victorian house in San Francisco.

definition: An ox is a large, strong breed of domestic cattle, traditionally kept for its strength in plowing and hauling heavy loads.
example: The farmer used the ox to pull the heavy cart filled with harvested crops.

definition: Oxygen is a chemical element with symbol O and atomic number 8. It is an essential component of the air we breathe, making up about 21% of Earth's atmosphere. It is a highly reactive gas that readily forms compounds with most elements and participates in respiration processes of plants and animals.
example: When you exhale, you are releasing carbon dioxide and water vapor, but also a small amount of oxygen, which gets replenished by the air around you. This continuous exchange is crucial for maintaining the oxygen levels necessary for human survival.

definition: Ozone is a highly reactive form of oxygen, characterized by having three oxygen atoms (O3). It exists naturally in the Earth's stratosphere, where it protects life from harmful ultraviolet radiation. Artificially, it is produced in an ozone generator or as a byproduct during electrical discharge.
example: The ozone layer in the stratosphere is thinning due to human activities such as the release of chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs).

definition: P.M., or Post Meridiem, is a Latin term that refers to "after midday." It's used in the 12-hour clock system to denote hours after noon.
example: I will meet you at 5 p.m. today at the park. (I will meet you at 5 hours after midday today at the park.)

definition: In Japanese, "pa" is a phonetic symbol used in the Romanization of Japanese words. It represents the "pa" sound and can be pronounced as "pah".
example: The Japanese word for apple, "ringo", is written in hiragana as ã‚Šã‚“ã” and in katakana as ãƒªãƒ³ã‚´. Using the Romanization system, it can also be spelled as "ringo" or "Ringo". In this case, "pa" represents the "ngo" sound in the word "ringo".

definition: Pace refers to a steady, regular speed at which something moves or happens, or the rhythm of steps taken while walking or running. It can also mean to progress at a steady rate over time.
example: The conductor adjusted the pace of the orchestra during the final movement of the symphony.

definition: Peaceful or calm; not aggressive or troubled. Also, relating to or situated in the Pacific Ocean or its countries.
example: Despite their differences, John and Sarah were able to find a pacific solution to their disagreement. The pacific region is known for its beautiful islands and diverse cultures.

definition: A pack is a collection of items or supplies, usually enclosed in some sort of container, often carried on one's back for transportation.
example: John packed his backpack with snacks, water, and a map before embarking on the hiking trail.

definition: A package is a collection of items or information that are wrapped, boxed, or otherwise assembled together and prepared for delivery or distribution.
example: She sent me a package containing a new phone, charger, and case as a birthday gift.

definition: To pack something means to put things into a container or a space so that they fit tightly. It can also refer to the state of being full or densely filled with people or items.
example: I need to pack my bags for the weekend trip. The stadium was packed with football fans during the final match.

definition: A packet is a collection of data transmitted as a single unit across a network. It contains both data and information about the data, such as its destination.
example: The email you sent was broken down into smaller packets for efficient transmission over the internet.

definition: Packing refers to the act of arranging items, typically in a container or suitcase, for transportation. It can also mean the containers used for these items.
example: Before her vacation, Jane spent hours packing her clothes, toiletries, and electronics into her suitcase.

definition: A pad is a thick, usually soft piece of material used to provide cushioning or protection. It can also refer to a thin flat mat for sitting or standing on.
example: In the computer game, he was padding his score by adding extra zeros at the end.

definition: A paddle is a flat piece of material, typically used to propel or steer a boat or canoe. It has a long handle attached for ease of use.
example: John grabbed the paddle and pushed it into the water, propelling his canoe forward through the calm lake.

definition: A page is one side of a sheet of paper in a book, document, or website. It usually contains text, images, or both and can be turned over to reveal the next page.
example: "I found the phone number on the third page of the contract."

definition: To give or receive money or some form of compensation in return for goods, services, or work. It often implies that the exchange has been completed.
example: "I paid $20 for this book at the store."

definition: Pain is an unpleasant sensation or discomfort that occurs when an organ or body part is injured, damaged, or stressed beyond its normal range.
example: "I felt a sharp pain in my finger after I accidentally slammed it with the hammer."

definition: Causing or characterized by physical or emotional distress or discomfort.
example: "The surgery was painful, but necessary for her recovery."

definition: To apply pigment to (a surface) in order to produce a decorative, symbolic, or representational design, or for a specific practical purpose.
example: She spent the afternoon painting the living room walls to give it a fresh, new look.

definition: A paintbrush is a tool used to apply paint or other liquid media onto a surface for the purpose of creating art or painting decorations.
