example: The old furniture in the attic was shabby and needed repair.

definition: Shade refers to a relatively dark area or region created by something that blocks light from an opposite or adjacent source, such as a tree, building, or shadow. It can also mean a cool, dark color, or to give someone a suggestive hint or indication without being direct.
example: The big oak tree provides plenty of shade for a relaxing afternoon picnic.

definition: The dark area or image produced when an opaque object intercepts or partially blocks light from a luminous source. It is a representation of the physical outline of the object without the actual substance.
example: The tall tree casts a long shadow on the grass during the afternoon.

definition: Having or producing shadows; dim, unclear, or obscure. Lacking transparency or clarity, often implying secrecy or mystery.
example: The government's dealings with the foreign power remained shadowy and unclear to the public.

definition: To cause something to move back and forth rapidly or violently, usually in a small space or up and down. Also refers to an act of showing fear or nervousness by trembling.
example: The witness shook when he testified in court about the crime he had witnessed.

definition: To cause someone or something to move forcefully and unsteadily due to vibration, turbulence, or emotion.
example: After the earthquake, everything in the room was shaken violently.

definition: Relating to or resembling the works, language, or style of William Shakespeare.
example: The play had a Shakespearean feel with its grandiose language and complex plot twists.

definition: Shaky refers to something that is unstable, trembling or liable to fall, move uncertainly, or lack firmness. It can also mean feeling fearful or nervous.
example: The old bridge was shaky and it made her feel uneasy as she crossed it.

definition: Shall is a modal verb used to express obligation, prediction, or intention. It is more formal than other modal verbs such as will.
example: The teacher shall begin the lesson promptly at 9 a.m.

definition: Shallow refers to something that is not deep, having little or no depth. It can also mean superficial or lacking in understanding, insight, or feeling.
example: She gave a shallow explanation for her actions, failing to address the real issues at hand. (Metaphorical shallow)

definition: A painful emotion caused by consciousness of guilt, wrong, or foolish behavior and shameful circumstances, accompanied by feelings of self-dislike.
example: "After being caught lying to her boss, she felt a deep sense of shame."

definition: Shameful refers to an act or situation that is morally unacceptable, causing a deep sense of regret and embarrassment.
example: His behavior at the company meeting was shameful; he publicly embarrassed everyone with his outburst.

definition: Shampoo is a cleansing agent, typically in liquid form, used to clean and condition the hair.
example: After a long day at work, she washed her hair with shampoo before applying conditioner.

definition: The form or outside structure of an object as distinguished by its length, width, and angles. It can be two-dimensional (flat and extended) or three-dimensional (having length, width, and depth).
example: The apple has a round shape, while the house has a rectangular shape.

definition: To share means to use or give something with another person or group, often in equal amounts or portions. It can also mean to give access to information or resources, or to contribute to a common purpose.
example: "John and Sarah decided to share the last slice of pizza between them."

definition: Sharp refers to something that has a pointed or angular quality, can be a physical object, sound, or metaphorically a keen awareness, wit, or sense.
example: The edge of the knife was very sharp, it could easily cut through paper. A fox's wit is as sharp as a tack, always finding its way out of trouble.

definition: Sharply refers to something that is sudden, distinct, or noticeably pronounced. It can also mean with a sharp edge, point, or angle.
example: The wind shifted sharply after the storm had passed.

definition: To shatter means to break something into many pieces or fragments, usually with a loud and forceful noise. It can also mean to disintegrate mentally or emotionally.
example: When I dropped the vase, it shattered on the floor. The sound was deafening.

definition: To remove hair from a part of the body, especially the face or underarms, usually by using a razor or an electric shaver.
example: Every morning, John shaves his beard to maintain a clean-shaven appearance.

definition: "She" is a third-person singular female pronoun in English, used to refer to a feminine subject.
example: "She is a talented scientist who discovered a new species of fish."

definition: A small outdoor structure used for storage or work, typically with no electricity or plumbing.
example: John kept his gardening tools in the shed.

definition: A sheep is a domesticated mammal belonging to the family Bovidae, which are primarily raised for their meat (mutton or lamb), milk (cheese and yogurt), wool, and skins.
example: In the field, Bella the sheep grazed contentedly with her fellow flock, munching on the green grass.

definition: Pure, absolute, or unqualified; utter. In the context of physical objects, it refers to something steep or vertical.
example: She stood at the sheer cliff edge, gazing down into the vast expanse of ocean below.

definition: A large, thin, flat piece of material used for various purposes such as bedding, writing, or covering surfaces.
example: She laid out the freshly washed sheets on the bed before going to sleep.

definition: A shelf is a flat surface, usually horizontal or sloping, attached to a wall or other vertical support for the storage of objects.
example: "There are several books on the shelf in the living room."

definition: A shell is a protective outer covering or casing, or it can refer to a program interface for accessing the functionality of an operating system or software.
example: To open files easily on the Linux system, you can use the command line shell. (In this case, referring to a computer interface)

definition: A place or structure that provides protection from harmful elements such as weather, danger, or unwanted attention.
example: "The homeless man found shelter in the church during the storm."

definition: A sheriff is a law enforcement officer who is typically the highest-ranking official in a county, responsible for maintaining peace and order within their jurisdiction.
example: The sheriff arrived at the scene of the accident to restore order and investigate what had happened.

definition: A shield is a flat piece of armor designed to protect a person or object from attacks, typically made of hard materials like metal and shaped to deflect or absorb blows.
example: In the heat of battle, the knight raised his shield to block the incoming arrow.

definition: A shift refers to a change or movement from one position, state, or activity to another, typically within a specific timeframe. It can also denote a period of work during the day or night.
example: After working the morning shift at the bakery, I'm taking the afternoon off to spend some quality time with my family.

definition: To shine means to give off light or brightness, often spontaneously. It can also be used figuratively to indicate something exceptional in terms of quality or performance.
example: The sun shines brilliantly during the day. (Literally) He has a natural talent that truly shines on stage. (Figuratively)

definition: Shiny refers to something that has a smooth, polished surface which reflects light and appears bright or glossy.
example: The golden apple in the display case was so shiny it looked as if it had just been polished.

definition: A ship is a large watercraft designed for navigation on rivers, seas, oceans, or other navigable waters. It is typically used for transporting goods or people from one place to another.
example: The cargo ship arrived at the port with goods from China after a two-month voyage across the Pacific Ocean.

definition: Shipping refers to the transportation of goods or merchandise from one place to another, usually by sea, air, rail, or road. It can also refer to the act of sending goods as a commercial enterprise, or in a more casual context, expressing strong feelings for someone romantically.
example: I can't help but feel some romantic feelings towards her, and every time she posts a picture, I find myself shipping them together. [Informal/romantic context]

definition: The act or event of a ship being destroyed, especially by crashing onto rocks or sinking in rough water. It may also refer to the losses (cargo, people) resulting from such an event.
example: Despite the stormy weather, the rescue team managed to reach the survivors of the shipwreck.

definition: A shirt is a garment, typically with sleeves, collars, and a closure at the front or neckline, worn by adults and children as an item of clothing. It can be made from various materials like cotton, silk, or polyester.
example: John wore a white dress shirt to his job interview.

definition: Shiver refers to the involuntary muscular contractions that occur when a person feels cold, causing the body to shake or tremble.
example: On a chilly winter morning, John stepped out of his warm house and immediately began to shiver from the cold wind blowing against him.

definition: A strong emotional disturbance or physical sensation caused by something unexpected, shocking, or traumatic. It may lead to feelings of fear, disbelief, or bewilderment.
example: After learning about the sudden death of her best friend, Sarah was left in a state of shock and couldn't think straight for days.

definition: To feel surprise, dismay, or fear in response to something unexpected, startling, or upsetting.
example: "When she found out about the sudden breakup, she was shocked and couldn't believe it."

definition: Causing deep surprise or disbelief, often due to something unexpectedly harsh, violent, or outrageous.
example: The news of his sudden death was shocking to everyone who knew him.

definition: A shoe is a flexible covering with a sole and upper designed to protect and fit around the foot. It typically has laces, straps, or fasteners for adjusting its fit.
example: She put on her black leather shoes before leaving for work.

definition: To direct a projectile from a weapon or to move swiftly in a particular direction, often forcefully.
example: Let me shoot your picture with my new camera.

definition: Shooting refers to the act of discharging a projectile from a weapon or camera. It can also mean the rapid movement or progression, typically in an uncontrolled or haphazard manner.
example: Stock prices were shooting up due to the positive earnings report. (Rapid increase or progression)

definition: A shop is a retail establishment where goods or services are sold to customers. Shops can be specialized (e.g., bookstores, electronics stores) or general (selling a variety of items).
example: John went to the local grocery shop to buy fresh vegetables for dinner.

definition: A shop assistant is an employee who works in a retail store, helping customers find and purchase goods.
example: The shop assistant at the bookstore helped me find a particular novel I was looking for.

definition: A shopkeeper is a person who owns, manages, or works in a retail store. They are responsible for selling goods and providing customer service.
example: The friendly shopkeeper at the local bookstore always remembered her regular customers' favorite books.

definition: Shoplifting is the act of stealing goods from a store without paying for them.
example: The security guard caught her shoplifting a high-end handbag from the department store.

definition: A shoplifter is an individual who steals goods from a retail store without paying for them.
example: The security camera captured a woman putting a designer handbag into her purse and exiting the store without paying, making her a shoplifter.

definition: Shoplifting is the act of stealing goods from a store without paying for them, often by concealing merchandise on one's person or in a bag.
example: John was caught shoplifting a pair of shoes from the department store after he left without paying.

definition: A shopper is a person who goes to stores, markets, or shops to buy goods.
example: "The busy holiday season sees many shoppers flooding the malls in search of gifts."

definition: The act of buying goods or food in a store or online. It often involves comparing prices, selecting items, and paying for them.
example: "Every weekend, she enjoys shopping for fresh produce at the local farmers market."

definition: The shore is the land near the edge of a sea, ocean, or large lake. It can include beaches, cliffs, and other coastal areas.
example: Every summer, my family visits the rocky shore of Maine to collect seashells and enjoy the cool ocean breeze.

definition: Short refers to something that is relatively small in length or duration, or lacking in extent or amount. It can also be used as an adjective to describe someone who is of average height or below the average.
example: The short skirt she was wearing made her feel self-conscious.

definition: Short refers to something that is relatively small in size or length, especially when compared to a standard. Shorts are a type of clothing that extend only to the thighs or mid-thigh, exposing the legs.
example: The athlete wore short shorts for better mobility during the race.

definition: A condition in which there is an inadequate or insufficient supply of something, such as goods, resources, or services.
example: There is a shortage of water in this region due to the prolonged drought.

definition: Shortly means in a short time or soon.
example: The manager will be here shortly, so we can start the meeting.

definition: A state or quality of being short in length.
example: The runner's shortness of breath was evident after the 100-meter dash.

definition: Relating to a period of time that is not very long. Typically, it refers to a period of less than one year.
example: "The company aims to increase profits in the short-term by reducing costs, but they are planning for long-term growth as well."

definition: A shot is a single discharge or attempt, typically referring to something being fired from a weapon such as a gun, cannon, or arrow. It can also be used more generally to refer to a quick, forceful action or the act of taking a photograph.
example: The police officer fired three shots into the air to disperse the crowd.

definition: "Should" is a modal verb used to express obligation, advice, expectation, or recommendation. It suggests that an action is desirable according to rules, good judgment, or reason.
example: "You should study for the exam tonight." (In this sentence, "should" implies that studying for the exam is what is expected or advisable due to the importance of the exam.)

definition: The shoulder is a part of the upper limb located between the neck and the arm, serving for the support and movement of the arm. It consists of three bones - the humerus, clavicle, and scapula.
example: I hurt my left shoulder during yesterday's game, so I'll need to take it easy today.

definition: Shout refers to a loud, forceful utterance of sound. It is often used to express excitement, surprise, anger, or urgency.
example: "John shouted 'Fire!' as he saw flames spreading through the kitchen."

definition: To present or make something visible, especially for other people to see. It can also mean to perform or display a skill, quality, or aspect.
example: The magician showed us some amazing tricks during the party.

definition: Showbiz refers to the entertainment industry, particularly the world of theater, film, television, and music. It encompasses both the creative aspects and the commercial side, often including glamour, publicity, and celebrity culture.
example: "Despite her initial reluctance, Sarah decided to pursue showbiz after landing a role in a popular TV series."

definition: To showcase something means to exhibit or display it in an attractive, effective, or prominent way, often for the purpose of demonstrating its quality, value, or capabilities.
example: The company plans to showcase their latest product at the upcoming technology trade fair.

definition: A shower is a bathroom fixture that allows water to be sprayed over a person for washing, usually from several nozzles in the ceiling or walls.
example: After a long day at work, John took a refreshing shower before going to bed.

definition: Shrimp is a type of decapod crustacean characterized by elongated bodies, a prognathous (projecting forward) head, and a tail with several branchiae. They are often small in size, commonly eaten as food, and are found in both saltwater and freshwater environments.
example: "I love the taste of grilled shrimp served with lemon and cocktail sauce."

definition: Shrink refers to the action or process of becoming smaller in size, or causing something to do so. It can also mean to reduce psychologically or mentally, as in the context of therapy.
example: The traumatic event caused her to shrink into a shell, unable to talk about it for years. (psychological shrinking)

definition: To shrug is to raise one's shoulders as a gesture of indifference, doubt, or uncertainty.
example: When asked about the upcoming exam, John simply shrugged his shoulders and replied, "I haven't started studying yet."

definition: To close or make tight so as to prevent the entrance or exit of something, or to stop functioning.
example: "John shut the door before leaving the house."

definition: Being timid, diffident, or bashful; reluctant to confront or approach people or situations that one does not know well.
example: Jane is usually very shy around new people, but she tries her best to be friendly when meeting someone for the first time.

definition: Sick refers to being unwell or experiencing illness in the body, or it can be used figuratively to describe something unpleasant, sad, or not good.
example: Her performance was really sick; I've never seen anyone dance like that before. (Figurative context - meaning impressive or excellent)

definition: Sickness refers to an abnormal condition of the body or mind, usually associated with some degree of discomfort, pain, and impaired functioning. It could be caused by illness, injury, or other factors that disrupt wellbeing.
example: John felt a sudden wave of sickness and had to leave the party early. He later found out he had the flu.

definition: A side refers to one aspect, part, or surface of something, or a position, opinion, or faction in relation to an issue. It can also mean a group or team participating in a contest or competition.
example: When the sun sets, we prefer taking a walk on the side of the street with fewer cars.

definition: A sidewalk is a path, usually paved, alongside a street or road for pedestrians to walk on. It provides a safe and convenient way for people to travel by foot, separate from vehicles.
example: I walked my dog every morning using the sidewalk that ran along our street.

definition: A deep, audible breath expressing disappointment, weariness, or sadness.
example: She sighed deeply as she read the disappointing news about her application.

definition: Sight is the ability to see things, or something seen; a spectacle or scene. It's one of the five traditional senses and involves light entering the eyes and being interpreted by the brain.
example: The sunset was a beautiful sight as it painted the sky with hues of orange and pink.

definition: Sightseeing is the activity of visiting places of interest or scenic beauty, typically for enjoyment.
example: "During our vacation in Europe, we spent most of our days doing sightseeing at famous historical sites like the Eiffel Tower and the Colosseum."

definition: A sign is something, often visible, that gives a message or provides information about a particular thing or action.
example: The traffic light turned red, so I stopped at the sign.

definition: A signal is a type of communication that indicates, warns, or instructs about something. It can be visual, auditory, or physical and often used in communication, navigation, or to convey specific information.
example: The green traffic light signaled that it was safe for vehicles to proceed.

definition: A signature is a unique mark, symbol, or name that is used to identify oneself. It may be handwritten, typed, or electronic and often serves as a form of authentication.
example: John signed the document with his personalized signature.

definition: Significance refers to something's importance, relevance, or value in a particular context. It can be used to describe the importance of an action, event, object, or concept.
example: The archaeological findings at the dig site were of great significance to understanding the history and culture of the ancient civilization.

definition: Important or meaningful, often in relation to something being large, considerable, or having a major impact.
example: The discovery of new elements in the periodic table is a significant contribution to the field of chemistry.

definition: Significantly means 'to a great or important degree', 'markedly', or 'noticeably'. It refers to something that has a large impact or is considerable in comparison.
example: The company's profits significantly increased after the launch of their new product line.

definition: To signify is to represent or symbolize something; to convey a meaning.
example: The red traffic light signifies "stop".

definition: A signpost is a structure used to guide travelers by indicating directions, names of places, distances, or warnings. It typically consists of a post with a signboard attached.
example: "As I was driving through the countryside, I saw a signpost directing me to the nearest town."

definition: A state of quietness or lack of sound, or the absence of speech or dialogue. It can also refer to a situation where one is prevented from speaking freely.
example: After the teacher asked a question in class, there was an awkward silence as everyone hesitated before answering.

definition: Making no sound or speaking; keeping quiet.
example: The library was silent, everyone focused on their reading without a sound.

definition: Quietly, without making sound; in a way that is not noticed.
example: He read the entire book silently during class.

definition: Silk is a natural protein fiber, usually spun by specific types of silkworms into cocoons, from which the fiber is extracted. It is known for its softness, lustrous appearance, and durability.
example: She wore a beautiful silk dress to the ball, causing everyone to admire her elegant style.

definition: Silliness is a state of being foolish, childish, or absurd, often associated with behaviors or statements that are not serious or sensible.
example: Despite knowing the rules, John decided to run in the library, making a silly and loud scene.

definition: Silver is a soft, white, precious metal, highly valued for its lustrous appearance, and used in coins, jewelry, and electronics. It has the chemical symbol Ag (atomic number 47).
example: I found an old silver coin from the 1800s at the antique store.

definition: Silverware refers to cutlery made primarily of silver or silver-plated metal, used for eating at the table.
example: After setting the dinner table, she carefully placed the silverware - fork, knife, spoon, and a pair of goblets - in their designated places.

definition: Similar means having characteristics, features, or qualities in common, but not necessarily identical.
example: "The two houses were similar, both had red roofs and white walls."

definition: Similarity refers to the quality or state of being alike in some ways, having common characteristics. It is a comparison that reveals resemblance or correspondence between things.
example: The two dresses are similar in color and design, making it difficult to tell them apart.

definition: Similarly means in a way that is comparable or alike to something else previously mentioned. It suggests a resemblance or parallel between the two situations, actions, or ideas being compared.
example: "John studies for his exams every night like Mary does." This sentence implies that John and Mary study for their exams in a way that is similar or alike to each other.

definition: Easy to understand, not complex or difficult; having few parts or requirements.
example: The recipe for a simple salad only requires three ingredients.

definition: Simplification is the act or process of making something simpler, clearer, or easier to understand by removing unnecessary complexity.
example: The mathematician simplified the complex equation by reducing it to a more straightforward expression that was easier for her students to grasp.

definition: To simplify means to make something less complex, easier to understand, or more efficient. It often involves reducing the number of parts or steps involved in a process.
example: The teacher asked students to simplify the mathematical equation as part of their homework exercise. In this case, they were asked to reduce a complex equation to a simpler form. For example, simplifying the equation (3x^2 + 5x - 2) + (6x^2 - 4x + 1) might result in (9x^2 + x - 1).

definition: To express or do something in a straightforward, clear, and uncomplicated manner. It implies that there is no need for complexity or elaboration.
example: "She simply told the truth, without any embellishments."

definition: Simultaneous refers to events, actions, or processes that occur at the same time.
example: The students were listening to a lecture and solving simultaneous equations on their computers.

definition: Simultaneously means happening at the same time or in quick succession without one event finishing before the other begins.
example: She checked her emails, made lunch, and listened to a podcast all simultaneously during her lunch break.

definition: "Since" is a conjunction or preposition that indicates a time from which something has been happening up until the present. It can also imply cause-effect relationship.
example: "I have not seen her since last summer." In this sentence, "since last summer" means the speaker has not seen the person in question from the start of the summer season up to the current time.

definition: Sincere refers to being honest, genuine, or heartfelt in one's emotions, intentions, or actions. It implies a lack of deceit and a true concern for others.
example: John was sincerely grateful for his friend's help, expressing his appreciation with genuine warmth.

definition: Sincerity refers to genuine feelings, honesty, and straightforwardness in one's words or actions. It is a quality that suggests openness, lack of pretense, and a deep conviction in one's beliefs.
example: John was known for his sincerity; he always spoke his mind without fear or favor.

definition: To produce musical sounds by using the voice, often accompanied by an instrument.
example: Jane loves to sing in the choir during church services on Sundays.

definition: A singer is a person who performs vocal music, either alone or accompanied by musical instruments.
example: BeyoncÃ© is a famous singer known for her powerful voice and dynamic stage performances.

definition: Singing is the act of producing musical sounds by using vocalization, often accompanied by musical instruments. It involves controlling the pitch, rhythm, and volume to create melodies or harmonies.
example: When she stepped onto the stage, she began singing a beautiful rendition of "Somewhere Over the Rainbow".

definition: Single refers to something or someone that is not part of a pair, set, or group. It can also mean unmarried or without a partner.
example: She has a single rose in her hand because she wanted to make the bouquet look simple.

definition: Singular refers to something that is one of its kind, unique, or not part of a group. In grammar, it often indicates the number one.
example: The owl hooted from a singular tree in the dark forest.

definition: A sink is a basin or container, usually fitted with a drain and taps, used for washing hands, dishes, or other objects. It's often found in kitchens and bathrooms.
example: After dinner, he washed the dishes in the kitchen sink before putting them away.

definition: "Sir" is a formal title of respect, often used to address a man who holds a high social position, is an officer in the military, or is old enough to be respected as a gentleman. It can also be used as a way to show politeness and deference.
example: "Good day, sir! How may I assist you today?" This sentence could be used when addressing a customer service representative or any man in a formal setting.

definition: A sister is a female sibling who shares at least one parent with an individual.
example: "My older sister helps me with my homework every day."

definition: Sister-in-law is a woman who is married to one's brother. She is the wife of one's brother and, by extension, the sister of one's spouse.
example: My sister-in-law recently had a baby girl, and I can't wait to meet her!

definition: To occupy a seat or to be in a position of rest on one's haunches.
example: The dog sits patiently while its owner prepares dinner.

definition: A site is a specific location or area, often associated with a particular purpose or function. This can range from a physical location (such as a building, land, or place of interest) to a virtual location on the internet.
example: The archaeologists are excavating an ancient site in Mexico. They believe it was once a bustling city.

definition: A sitting room is a comfortable, informal room in a house where people can relax, socialize, or engage in quiet activities. It often has furniture such as sofas, armchairs, and tables.
example: After dinner, we usually retreat to the sitting room for some conversation and a cup of tea.

definition: A situation is a set of circumstances or events that exist at a specific time and place, often involving people or objects. It can refer to an actual occurrence or a possible one, depending on the context.
example: "The teacher was faced with a difficult situation when a student refused to participate in class."

definition: Six is a number that comes after five and before seven, often denoting a group or set of six items.
example: There are six apples in the basket.

definition: The number sixteen represents a count of 16 items or the numerical value that comes after fifteen and before seventeen. It is also called a "dozen plus four.".
example: There are sixteen apples in the basket.

definition: Sixty is a number, specifically the numeral representing the count of sixty objects or units. It follows fifty-nine and precedes sixty-one in a sequence of numbers.
example: There are sixty minutes in an hour.

definition: Size refers to the physical dimensions or extent of something, often measured in specific units such as inches, centimeters, pounds, or kilograms. It can be used to describe the height, width, depth, or weight of an object or space.
example: The size of the new house is 2000 square feet.

definition: Skate is a type of shoe with smooth wheels on a metal or plastic base, used for moving quickly over a hard surface, particularly ice. It can also refer to the action of moving or gliding along on skates.
example: John loves winter sports and enjoys skating on the frozen lake every weekend.

definition: A skateboard is a transport device consisting of a flat wooden or plastic platform mounted on wheels, used for performing tricks and traveling on rough surfaces.
example: John enjoys skating at the local park on his skateboard after school.

definition: A skateboarder is an individual who rides, performs tricks on, or uses a skateboard for recreation or competition.
example: The teenager spent hours each day practicing tricks as a dedicated skateboarder at the local skate park.

definition: Skateboarding is an action sport that involves riding on and performing tricks using a skateboard, which consists of a flat wooden or fiberglass platform with four wheels attached.
example: John enjoys skateboarding at the local skatepark, executing various flips and grinds on ramps and rails.

definition: Skating refers to moving on land or ice using specialized shoes or boots with sharp metal blades attached. It can be recreational, a competitive sport, or an artistic performance.
example: John enjoys skating at the local ice rink every Sunday morning before work.

definition: The skeleton is the internal framework of the body of an animal, supporting and protecting its various organs. It consists mainly of bones, cartilage, and some types of tissue.
example: After digging up remains in the backyard, we found a human skeleton with twenty-six vertebrae, suggesting it was not from a child or an adult over seventy.

definition: A sketch is a quick, rough drawing that serves as a preparatory work or an outline to visualize ideas for a more detailed artwork, design, or plan. It can also refer to a brief informal description or summary of something.
example: Before painting the landscape, she made a quick sketch to capture the general composition and proportions of the scene.

definition: Ski refers to a long, flat piece of material with fixed or movable bindings attached, used for sliding over snow. It is typically shaped like a narrow board and is designed for downhill travel on snow.
example: Last winter, John went skiing in the Swiss Alps with his family. They spent the entire day going up and down the slopes, enjoying the beautiful scenery and the cold, crisp air.

definition: Skiing is a popular winter sport that involves sliding down snow-covered slopes while standing on specially designed skis.
example: John loves skiing in the Swiss Alps during his winter vacations.

definition: A skill is the ability to perform a specific task or function efficiently and effectively, often acquired through training or experience.
example: John has developed excellent cooking skills over the years, allowing him to create delicious meals for his family every night.

definition: Having a high level of ability, expertise, or proficiency in a particular activity, job, or field.
example: The surgeon was incredibly skilled, performing the operation with precision and grace.

definition: Skillful or skilful refers to having and showing a high level of aptitude, dexterity, or ability in some particular activity or field. It often implies proficiency or expertise gained through experience and practice.
example: The pianist was incredibly skillful; his fingers danced effortlessly across the keys with incredible finesse.

definition: Skillfully or skilfully means with great skill, proficiency, or dexterity.
example: The painter skillfully blended the colors to create a realistic landscape painting.

definition: To skim is to scan or read quickly the surface of something, typically to get a general idea or the main points without going into detail. It can also refer to moving lightly and smoothly over the surface of water.
example: She quickly skimmed through the email to see if there was any important news. (Reading example)

definition: Skin is the outer covering of an animal or human body, providing a protective barrier and sensory receptors. It's made up of layers including the epidermis, dermis, and hypodermis.
example: I need to apply sunscreen to protect my skin from harmful UV rays.

definition: To move or cause something to move along without stopping at regular intervals, to jump over.
example: The child skipped happily down the street, not wanting to walk slowly.

definition: A skirt is a women's clothing item consisting of a series of vertical panels, attached at the waist and falling to varying lengths below the hips. It can have slits or pleats for mobility.
example: She wore a blue flared skirt with a matching blouse for her job interview.

definition: The sky is the large open space above the Earth where we see the atmosphere and the celestial bodies, such as the sun, moon, stars, and planets.
example: I love watching the beautiful pink sky during sunset.

definition: A skylark is a small, agile bird with a slender beak and a long, forked tail. Known for their acrobatic flight and melodious songs, they are typically found in open country or farmland.
example: "As I walked through the rolling fields, the skylark's enchanting melody filled the air."

definition: A tall, continuously habitable building with multiple stories and an overall height significantly taller than nearby structures.
example: The Empire State Building in New York City is a famous skyscraper that was once the tallest building in the world.

definition: Skyward refers to an upward direction or the sky itself.
example: The fireworks shot straight up into the sky, reaching ever higher towards the skyward expanse.

definition: To slam is to make a loud, forceful sound when striking something or to move with great force. It can also mean to accuse or criticize someone harshly and abruptly, often in an emotional outburst.
example: 1. He slammed the door shut, making everyone jump.

definition: Slang refers to informal, non-standard language that is specific to a particular group or region. It often changes rapidly and may be considered informal, colloquial, or unconventional in comparison to standard or formal language.
example: "Hey bro, what's the lowdown on the fresh new hangout spot?" In this sentence, the words "bro", "lowdown", and "fresh" are examples of slang terms. The speaker is using these terms in an informal context to convey friendship, curiosity, and excitement.

definition: To strike or hit (someone) forcefully on a part of the body, especially the face, with an open hand.
example: "John was angry and slapped Mary across the face."

definition: The act of killing a large number of animals or people cruelly, often for food or war.
example: After the invasion, the town witnessed a horrifying slaughter of innocent civilians.

definition: A slave is a person who is owned by another and forced to work without pay, typically under harsh conditions. This relationship exists in various forms throughout history, often based on racial or social discrimination.
example: "In the 1800s, many African Americans were forcibly enslaved in the United States, working against their will on plantations to grow crops such as cotton and tobacco."

definition: Slavery is a system in which people are treated as property and forced to work without pay, typically under the threat of violence or other punishments. They have no control over their own lives and are completely subjected to the will of their masters.
example: During the 1800s in the United States, many African Americans were enslaved by white landowners, being forced to work on plantations without pay or basic human rights.

definition: Sleep is a naturally occurring state of rest for the mind and body, characterized by reduced consciousness, temporarily suspended sensory activity, and inactivity of muscles, typically occuring at night. It plays a vital role in physical health and mental well-being.
example: After a long day at work, John decided to sleep early so he could feel rested and refreshed the next morning.

definition: Sleepless refers to being without sleep or unable to sleep.
example: Despite taking a sleeping pill, she remained sleepless throughout the night due to her worries about the upcoming exam.

definition: Sleepy refers to feeling or looking drowsy, tired, or likely to fall asleep.
example: "After working late into the night, John found himself becoming increasingly sleepy during the afternoon meeting."

definition: A sleeve is a long, narrow section of fabric or material that covers and protects an arm or another part, often as part of a garment.
example: She rolled up the sleeves of her shirt before starting to work on the messy project.

definition: A slice is a piece cut from a larger whole, typically flat and thin. It often refers to food but can also describe other objects or situations where something is divided in this manner.
example: I'd like a slice of pizza please. (In this context, "slice" refers to a single serving cut from a pizza.)

definition: A slide is a smooth, usually flat surface designed to move back and forth without support, often used for transportation or play, such as on a playground. It can also refer to a projector screen that displays visual content, or to a movement or transition from one state to another in a smooth or continuous manner.
example: The children love going down the slide at the park.

definition: Slight refers to something that is small in degree, amount, or importance. It can also mean a delicate, subtle touch, or a hint of something.
example: The difference in their heights was quite slight, barely noticeable to the naked eye.

definition: Slightly refers to something that is not very great or extreme but just a little, or in a small degree.
example: The weather today was slightly cooler than yesterday.

definition: Slim refers to having a thin or narrow build, with minimal body fat.
example: Despite eating a lot, John manages to stay slim by running every day.

definition: To slide or move unintentionally, often due to being careless. Also, an error or mistake, especially one that occurs unexpectedly.
example: He made a small slip in his presentation when he read the wrong data. (Verbal slip)

definition: A sliver is a thin, narrow piece or fragment that has been cut or broken off something. It's often thin and splinter-like.
example: After breaking the vase, I found a silver of glass on the floor.

definition: A slogan is a memorable phrase or expression, often used in a commercial, political, or promotional context to inform, persuade, or rally support for a product, idea, or cause.
example: "Just Do It" - a popular slogan by Nike that encourages people to participate in sports and physical activities.

definition: Slope refers to the degree of incline or decline in a line connecting two points, often expressed as the ratio of the vertical distance to the horizontal distance. It can also refer to the steepness or gradient of a surface.
example: The slope of the roof is 4:12, meaning for every 4 units horizontally, it rises 1 unit vertically.

definition: Sloppy refers to something that is carelessly or untidily done, lacking neatness, precision, or attention to detail. It can also describe a person who is unkempt or careless in their actions or behavior.
example: The teacher was frustrated with the students' sloppy handwriting on the exam. John's sloppy dressing sense made him stand out at the formal event.

definition: A slot is a narrow opening or allotted space for a particular purpose or to receive something.
example: The coins go in the slots of the vending machine to dispense a drink.

definition: Adjective used to describe something that moves, happens, or is done at a pace that is not fast or quick.
example: The traffic was slow today, causing me to arrive late for work.

definition: Slowly refers to moving, progressing, or changing at a pace that is not fast. It suggests a gradual and often deliberate pace.
example: The snail moved slowly across the path.

definition: Small refers to something that is relatively not large or big in size. It can be used to describe objects, amounts, or even people.
example: The kitten was small and fit comfortably in the palm of her hand.

definition: Smart refers to something or someone that has the ability to learn, understand, and apply knowledge effectively. It also implies intelligence or superior mental power.
example: The smartphone can connect to the internet, send emails, and even recognize your voice commands, making it a truly smart device.

definition: To break something apart by hitting it forcefully.
example: He smashed the glass with a hammer.

definition: Smell is the ability to detect chemicals in the air using specialized receptor cells lining the nose. It allows us to identify various substances, often used to recognize food, danger, or emotions.
example: The freshly baked bread wafted through the kitchen, filling the room with a delightful aroma that made everyone's stomach rumble.

definition: A smile is a facial expression that shows pleasure, happiness, or goodwill. It involves raising the cheeks and turning up the corners of the lips to give a curve that is visible above the teeth (in humans).
example: "Despite the challenging circumstances, John always managed to keep a smile on his face, spreading positivity wherever he went."

definition: A smith is a skilled worker who makes or repairs metal objects, such as swords, armor, tools, or household items.
example: The blacksmith hammered away at the glowing metal, shaping it into a beautiful sword.

definition: Smoke is a visible airborne material consisting of fine particles and gas emitted under combustion or chemical reactions. It often has an odor and reduces visibility.
example: When I lit the cigarette, it began to smoke heavily.

definition: A smoker is a person who regularly inhales and exhales smoke from tobacco products, such as cigarettes, cigars, or pipes.
example: "John is a smoker and often steps outside for a cigarette break during work hours."

definition: A smokestack is a tall, vertical chimney-like structure that vents smoke and gases from factories, power plants, or other industrial facilities.
example: The smokestack at the steel mill billowed dark plumes of smoke into the sky.

definition: Smoking refers to the act of inhaling and exhaling the smoke from burning tobacco or other substances, usually using a pipe, cigarette, or cigar.
example: John decided to quit smoking after learning about its negative effects on health.

definition: Smooth refers to something that is even, uninterrupted, or without bumps or roughness. It can also indicate an easy flow or progression.
example: The road was smooth and perfect for a fast drive.

definition: Smoothly refers to a continuous, uninterrupted, or effortless manner. It implies an absence of friction, difficulty, or obstruction.
example: She smoothly navigated through the crowded room, easily making conversation with everyone she met.

definition: A small meal or light refreshment eaten between meals, often of a savory or sweet nature.
example: "After her morning workout, she usually has a snack like an apple and peanut butter."

definition: A long, legless reptile with elongated body, covered in scales, and equipped with movable, forked tongues. It usually has two eyes on the top of its head.
example: "The garden was overgrown with tall grass, hiding a slithering snake."

definition: Snap is a sudden, sharp sound made by something breaking or being pulled apart quickly. It can also refer to taking a photograph quickly.
example: When I stepped on the twig, it made a snap. (For the second definition) In this moment, I'll snap a quick photo with my phone before we move on.

definition: To move quietly or secretly, typically in order to avoid being seen or heard.
example: He sneaked into the house when no one was home.

definition: To sneer is to express scorn, contempt, or disdain by making a facial expression with a curled upper lip. It can also refer to making a sound that suggests contempt or mockery.
example: Despite her attempt to hide it, the boss couldn't help but sneer at the junior employee's suggestion during the meeting.

definition: A sneeze is a sudden, forceful expulsion of air and small particles from the nose and mouth due to irritation in the nasal passages, usually caused by allergies, colds, or dust.
example: "I've caught a cold and I keep sneezing whenever I'm around people."

definition: To inhale the air, typically to catch a scent or smell.
example: The dog started sniffing around the flowers, trying to find its favorite scent.

definition: Snore is the act or sound of breathing with harsh, rhythmic, and usually loud, irregular breaths while sleeping. It typically produces a noise that may disturb others who are nearby.
example: Every night, John's husband snored loudly, waking him up multiple times throughout the night.

definition: Snow is a form of precipitation in the solid state, consisting of ice crystals that fall from clouds. It is a common occurrence in cold regions and can accumulate on the ground to provide a white covering known as snowfall or a snowpack.
example: The children were excited because it had started snowing, and they hoped to build a snowman later in the day.

definition: A snowball is a small, round mass of compacted snow that is rolled into a ball and thrown or played with. It is often formed by rolling a small amount of snow in your hands and packing it tightly.
example: After the snowfall, the children went outside to make snowballs and throw them at each other.

definition: A snowboard is a recreational equipment designed to slide on snow. It consists of a flat, long piece of plastic or wood with bindings attached for the feet and a pair of metal edges at the bottom for directional control.
example: "John enjoys snowboarding down the steep slopes of Mount Everest during winter."

definition: Snowboarding is an outdoor winter sport in which a person rides on a snowboard attached to their feet and descends snow-covered slopes, typically by using a special snowboard binding to connect the board to the rider's boots.
example: John loves snowboarding down the steep mountains during winter weekends.

definition: A snowstorm is a severe meteorological event characterized by heavy snowfall and strong wind for an extended period of time.
example: During the winter, our small town was hit by a massive snowstorm, causing schools to close and roads to become impassable.

definition: Snowy describes something that is covered or filled with snow, or something that has a great deal of snow falling or visible.
example: The mountains were snowy and beautiful in the winter sunshine.

definition: "So" is an adverb that can be used to introduce a conclusion, explain something in more detail, emphasize a point, or indicate the reason for something. It can also function as a conjunction to connect related ideas.
example: "It was raining heavily, so I decided to stay indoors and read a book." (In this case, "so" connects the reason for the action.)

definition: To saturate or cover something with liquid, usually water, so that it becomes wet and soft. The action of immersing an object in a liquid.
example: After a long day at work, she decided to soak her feet in warm water with some bath salts.

definition: Soaked refers to something that has absorbed moisture until it is wet or saturated.
example: After the heavy rain, my boots were soaked and I couldn't walk comfortably.

definition: Soaking refers to the act of immersing or saturating something in a liquid, usually water. It can also mean absorbing or penetrating a substance slowly and thoroughly.
example: After a long day at work, she decided to soak her feet in a warm bath with Epsom salts.

definition: Soap is a cleansing agent, typically made from oil or fat, alkali, and water. It has the ability to remove dirt, grease, and odor from surfaces.
example: After a long day at work, I washed my hands with a bar of soap before cooking dinner.

definition: Soap opera is a long-running, serialized drama on television. These shows typically feature interrelated families, emotional conflicts, and melodramatic or sensational plots.
example: "Every evening at 7 pm, the Johnson family's latest drama unfolds in the popular soap opera 'Daytime Drama.'"

definition: To soar means to rise and fly high in the air, typically gracefully or effortlessly. It can also be used figuratively to mean to increase rapidly or greatly in a positive way.
example: After receiving an excellent grade on her exam, Sarah's spirits soared. (Figurative soaring)

definition: Sob is an audible sound of deep, emotional crying or weeping. It's usually a loud and sudden burst of tears, often accompanied by gasps for breath.
example: After hearing the sad news, she couldn't control her emotions and let out a series of sobs.

definition: The term "so-called" is used to express skepticism or questioning about a label, title, or name that has been given to something. It implies that the designation may not be accurate or reliable.
example: Despite being called a luxury resort, this place lacks basic amenities and services.

definition: Soccer is a popular team sport played between two teams of 11 players each. It involves kicking a round ball into the opposing team's goal to score points.
example: "John loves soccer and plays for his school team every Saturday afternoon."

definition: Sociable refers to someone who enjoys spending time with others, being friendly and outgoing, and having a good social life. It can also describe a group or setting that encourages interaction and friendship.
example: Jane is very sociable; she loves hosting parties and knows everyone in town.

definition: Relating to society or its organization, interactions between individuals within that society, or the way in which a person behaves as part of society.
example: "John enjoys socializing with his friends at local cafes."

definition: Social networking refers to the use of dedicated online platforms or websites, such as Facebook, LinkedIn, or Twitter, to create and maintain social connections, share information, and interact with others who have similar interests.
example: Mary joined a popular social networking site to reconnect with old friends from high school and also to keep up-to-date on their current activities.

definition: To interact with others in a friendly or sociable way, often in a group or public setting. It can also refer to the act of developing professional relationships or connections.
example: "After staying home for so long due to the pandemic, John decided it was time to socialize again and joined a local club."

definition: Relating to society or the interaction of individuals within a group. It often refers to behavior, activities, relationships, or customs in a social context.
example: She is very socially active, always participating in community events and fundraisers.

definition: A group of people living under a common social, political, or national institution and having law and custom in common. It can refer to a broad population or a specific community sharing interests, values, and norms.
example: The society organized a charity event to help those affected by the natural disaster.

definition: A sock is a piece of footwear worn on the foot, usually with a matching covering for the hand called a glove. It is typically tubular and has a heel and a toe, designed to cover and protect the foot.
example: I need to find my blue socks before I can go outside for a walk.

definition: Soda is a carbonated, sweetened beverage that is usually flavorful and non-alcoholic. It can be clear or colored and is often served cold.
example: I'd like a cold glass of soda with my meal, please. (Here, the specific type of soda isn't mentioned, but it could be cola, lemon-lime, root beer, etc.)

definition: A sofa is a piece of furniture designed primarily for sitting, typically with upholstered cushions and a back and arms. It's often used as the main seating in living rooms or lounges.
example: "We spent the afternoon watching movies on our comfortable new sofa."

definition: Soft refers to something that is not hard or rigid, has little resistance when pressure is applied, and can be easily deformed or compressed. It may also describe a quality of mildness, gentleness, or lack of firmness in terms of temperament or tone.
example: The baby's skin was so soft, like the petals of a rose.

definition: A soft drink is a non-alcoholic beverage that typically contains carbonated water, sweeteners, and various flavorings.
example: I'd like a cold bottled Coke for lunch, please.

definition: Softly refers to a sound or movement that is quiet, gentle, and not harsh.
example: She whispered softly into the microphone before starting her speech.

definition: Softness refers to the quality or state of being gentle, tender, or mild. It can also describe a material that is pliable, flexible, and easily compressed without breaking.
example: The new baby's skin was so soft, like velvet against her fingers.

definition: Software refers to a set of programs, data, and related documentation that perform specific tasks on computers or other electronic devices.
example: "I am installing the latest version of Adobe Photoshop software on my computer for editing photos."

definition: Soil refers to the upper layer of Earth's surface that supports plant life and is composed of mineral particles, organic matter, water, and air.
example: The farmer carefully tilled the rich soil in preparation for planting his crops.

definition: Solar refers to anything related to the Sun, its energy or light. It can also refer to systems that use sunlight for energy purposes, such as solar panels.
example: The family installed solar panels on their roof to reduce their dependence on electricity from the grid.

definition: A soldier is a member of an army, especially one who is enlisted to fight in time of war. They are trained for combat and military operations.
example: The young man joined the army after graduating from college and became a brave soldier, serving his country with distinction during the conflict.

definition: Solid is a state of matter where particles are closely packed together, allowing them to maintain their shape and volume. They cannot be easily compressed or decompressed under normal conditions.
example: The stone was solid and couldn't be pushed into the jar because it was too hard.

definition: Solidity is a high-level programming language used for developing smart contracts and decentralized applications (dApps) on the Ethereum blockchain. It enables developers to write secure, efficient, and upgradable code.
example: "The team is working on writing solidity code for their new decentralized finance (DeFi) platform, ensuring it provides a robust, user-friendly experience while adhering to the Ethereum blockchain's best practices."

definition: A soliloquy is a speech or long monologue delivered by a character in a play, meant to reveal their thoughts, feelings, or inner conflicts that are not addressed to anyone else on stage.
example: In Shakespeare's Hamlet, Hamlet stands alone and delivers a famous soliloquy beginning with "To be, or not to be..." This speech allows the audience to understand Hamlet's struggle between living and dying.

definition: Solo refers to something done alone or separately, particularly in the context of music, where a solo is a piece played or sung by one instrument or voice.
example: The guitarist chose to perform a solo during the concert, showcasing his exceptional skill.

definition: A solution is a liquid in which a solute (a solid, liquid, gas or dissolved solid) is uniformly distributed. It is the result of solving a problem or finding an answer to a question.
example: The salt water at the seashore is a solution, where salt acts as the solute and water acts as the solvent. In mathematics, finding the square root of 9 is a solution to the equation x^2 = 9.

definition: To find an answer, solution, or method to resolve a problem or puzzle.
example: The student solved the equation 2x + 3 = 7 by finding x = 1.5.

definition: A solvent is a substance that can dissolve another solid, liquid, or gas to produce a homogeneous solution. The solvent is generally not chemically changed by the process of dissolving, and it retains its original properties.
example: Water (H2O) is often used as a solvent in various chemical reactions because it can dissolve many substances, such as sugar or salt. For example, when you mix water with sugar, the sugar particles disperse evenly throughout the water, creating a solution where neither substance loses its identity. This makes water a universal solvent in everyday life.

definition: Some refers to an indefinite quantity or amount of something, implying a small but unspecified number or amount. It is used to indicate that there is a certain but unknown or indeterminate amount or number.
example: I have some apples in my bag. (This implies that the speaker has more than one apple but does not know exactly how many.)

definition: Somebody refers to an unspecified or indefinite person or people.
example: "Somebody left the window open, let's close it before we get cold."

definition: "Someday" refers to an unspecified future time or period, implying a vague or indeterminate point in the future. It often implies a hopeful or ambitious plan or goal that one plans to accomplish at some undetermined time in the future.
example: "I want to learn French someday when I retire."

definition: Somehow refers to finding a way, managing to do something despite difficulties or in an unexpected manner.
example: I couldn't believe it, but somehow they managed to fix the car with just duct tape and wire.

definition: Someone is any person or individuals who are being referred to in a particular context.
example: "Someone left the door open, let's close it."

definition: Someplace refers to any specific, unspecified location or place.
example: I don't know where I'll go for vacation, but I want to visit someplace warm and sunny.

definition: Something is an unspecified or non-specific object, event, or idea. It usually refers to a vague or general concept without providing specific details.
example: I need something to drink. (Here, "something" implies that the speaker doesn't have a particular drink in mind.)

definition: Sometime refers to an unspecified or indefinite time in the future. It implies that the exact time is not known or important at this moment.
example: "I'll see you sometime next week." This means that the speaker does not know the exact day they will meet, only that it will be within the upcoming seven days.

definition: Sometimes refers to an occurrence that is not constant but happens at irregular intervals or on specific occasions.
example: "I sometimes visit my grandparents during the weekend."

definition: Somewhat means to a moderate or partial extent, somewhat is used to indicate something that has some, but not all, of the characteristics being described.
example: She is somewhat shy around new people, but she becomes more outgoing once she feels comfortable.

definition: Somewhere refers to a general or unspecified place or location.
example: I will be back sometime next week, but I don't know exactly where - somewhere in the city.

definition: A son is a male offspring, usually biologically related to one's parents, in human families. It can also refer to someone who is like a son, especially a younger person treated with great affection by an older person who is not their biological parent.
example: "My son just graduated from college and got his first job."

definition: A song is a musical composition with words, often consisting of verses and choruses, that expresses thoughts, emotions, or tells a story. It's typically sung by one or more voices, usually accompanied by musical instruments.
example: She hummed a cheerful tune as she walked down the street, it was her favorite song about summer days.

definition: A son-in-law is the husband of one's daughter or a man related by marriage to a woman. It is typically used in an English-speaking context for the partner of one's child, though the term can also be applied more broadly in some cultures.
example: "My son-in-law, John, is a brilliant software engineer and a wonderful addition to our family."

definition: A sonnet is a form of poetry consisting of 14 lines, traditionally used to express complex emotional states. It often follows a strict rhyme scheme and metrical pattern.
example: "Shall I compare thee to a summer's day? Thou art more lovely and more temperate: Rough winds do shake the darling buds of May, And summer's lease hath all too short a date; Sometime too hot the eye of heaven shines, And often is his gold complexion drowned; Oft have I seen him on a damp cloth wipe his eyes, And starting in myself that string of tears..." This is William Shakespeare's Sonnet 18, "Shall I Compare Thee to a Summer's Day?"

definition: Soon refers to a time that is not far in the future. It's used when something is expected or going to happen relatively quickly, but it doesn't specify an exact moment.
example: "I will visit you soon after I finish this project."

definition: To calm, comfort, or alleviate pain or discomfort in someone or something. It is often used to describe actions that bring relief or peace.
example: After a long day at work, she took a warm bath to soothe her tired muscles.

definition: Advanced, complex, or refined in design, understanding, or culture. It often implies a level of knowledge, skill, or technology beyond the ordinary or simple.
example: The security system at the museum was very sophisticated; it required a special code to access the exhibits.

definition: A sophomore is a student who is in the second year of high school or college.
example: "John is a sophomore this year at his university."

definition: A sore is an area of irritation, inflammation, or damage on the skin or mucous membranes that causes pain or discomfort.
example: "After a long hike, my feet were sore and blistered."

definition: A feeling of very sadness caused by loss, disappointment, or regret.
example: After losing her best friend, she felt an overwhelming sorrow that made it difficult to smile for days.

definition: An expression of regret, apology, or sympathy for causing hurt, inconvenience, trouble, etc. to someone else.
example: "I'm sorry for keeping you waiting; traffic was terrible today."

definition: To arrange or classify things according to a particular characteristic or criterion.
example: "Let's sort these apples by size before we take them to the market."

definition: The soul is often considered the spiritual or immortal part of a living being that is thought to be separate from the physical body and capable of surviving death. It is associated with emotion, consciousness, and the sense of identity.
example: Despite her tragic accident, many believe that her soul lived on through her art.

definition: Sound is a vibration that travels through an elastic medium or through the air and can be heard when it reaches a person's or animal's ear. It is a mechanical wave with alternating compression and rarefaction of the medium.
example: The sound of the birds chirping early in the morning is music to my ears.

definition: A soundtrack is a collection of songs, instrumental pieces, and other audio effects that are used in film, television shows, video games, or other media. It provides the background music and ambient sounds for the production.
example: The soundtrack of the movie "The Lion King" features songs like "Circle of Life," "Hakuna Matata," and "Can You Feel the Love Tonight."

definition: A liquid dish, typically made from stock or broth, meat or vegetables, and seasonings, that is often served hot as part of a meal.
example: I enjoyed a hearty bowl of minestrone soup with fresh vegetables and beans for lunch today.

definition: Sour refers to something that is tart, acidic, or having a taste that is sharp and puckering. It's often associated with fruits like lemons or vinegar.
example: The lemonade was too sour; I needed more sugar in it.

definition: A source is an origin or originator of something, typically serving as a basis for information or supply. It can be either a person, place, or thing that provides knowledge, facts, or materials.
example: The newspaper article about the new technology was based on a reliable scientific source.

definition: South refers to the direction that is 180 degrees away from north, and is typically associated with locations toward the equator. It is one of the four principal points of the compass.
example: The sun sets in the west and rises in the east, but today it feels like it's setting in the south because we are on vacation at the equator.

definition: Southeast refers to the direction or region located diagonally between south and east.
example: The Southeast region of the United States includes states such as Florida, Georgia, Alabama, Mississippi, and Louisiana.

definition: Adjective used to describe or indicate something, someone, or someplace that is in or coming from the south.
example: The weather in the southern states of America can be quite hot during summer.

definition: Southward refers to the direction toward or located in the southern part of a region, continent, or the world. It is the opposite of northward.
example: The migratory birds flew southward during the winter season to escape the cold.

definition: Southwest refers to a cardinal direction that is located 180 degrees away from north, and 90 degrees away from west. It is used to identify geographical locations or points on a compass.
example: The city of Albuquerque is located in the southwestern United States.

definition: A souvenir is a small keepsake or item, typically bought during a visit to a place of interest, that serves as a reminder of the experience.
example: After our vacation in Paris, we brought back a beautiful Eiffel Tower keychain as a souvenir.

definition: Soviet refers to the former union of republics that existed in Eastern Europe and northern Asia, known as the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR), from 1922 to 1991. It was a single-party socialist state under the rule of the Communist Party.
example: During the Cold War, the USSR and the United States were rival superpowers, competing in political, economic, and military terms.

definition: Soybean is a type of legume (family Fabaceae), native to East Asia, with its largest cultivation now in the United States. It's an important source of vegetable oil and soy meal as animal feed.
example: Farmers planted soybeans this season for both cooking oil and livestock feed production.

definition: A spa is a facility that provides health-related services, including massage, body treatments, and various therapies, often using water. It's designed to promote relaxation, wellness, and rejuvenation.
example: "After a long week of work, I decided to treat myself by booking a day at the spa for a relaxing massage and facial."

definition: Space refers to a continuous area or expanse that is free, available, or unoccupied. It can also refer to the vastness of the universe beyond the Earth's atmosphere.
example: There is plenty of space in the back of my car for your luggage.

definition: A spaceship is a vehicle designed to travel through outer space. It's usually equipped with propulsion, navigation, and life support systems to sustain its occupants during the journey.
example: The astronauts boarded their sleek, silver spaceship and blasted off into the cosmos on a mission to explore Mars.

definition: Spaghetti is a long, thin, cylindrical pasta made from durum wheat semolina or other types of flour, traditionally served with a savory sauce.
example: "For dinner tonight, I'm going to make spaghetti with marinara sauce and meatballs."

definition: The term "span" generally refers to a period of time or a distance that is measured between two points. It can also refer to the range of values that a set covers, or the ability to stretch or cover a certain area.
example: The bridge has a span of 400 feet from one end to the other.

definition: Spare means to have or keep something in reserve, not currently being used. It can also mean to relieve or save someone from trouble.
example: The boss decided not to penalize John for his mistake because he felt it would be too harsh and spared him this time.

definition: Sparerib is a cut of meat from a pig that includes the upper ribs and part of the breastbone. It consists of several long, curved bones coated in fat and lean meat.
example: I'm cooking barbecued spareribs for dinner tonight, served with coleslaw and corn on the cob.

definition: A spark is a small, bright, momentary burst of light produced by the rapid movement of electrically charged particles or chemical reaction, often indicating ignition. It can also refer metaphorically to something that stimulates or initiates action, thought, or feeling.
example: The teacher's passionate speech about education sparked a wave of enthusiasm among the students. (Metaphorical example)

definition: To sparkle is to shine with a bright, intermittent, and typically flashing or glittering light, often in a lively or attractive way. It can also be used metaphorically to describe something that excites, delights, or stimulates in an appealing manner.
example: His storytelling had a way of sparkling with humor and wit, captivating his audience every time. (Metaphorical example)

definition: Shining or glittering with tiny flashes of light, typically due to a surface being smooth and reflective. It can also refer to something effervescent or lively.
example: The champagne was sparkling in the sunlight, catching everyone's attention as they entered the party. Or, Her eyes sparkled with mischief as she whispered her secret to her friend.

definition: A sparrow is a small, typically brown, bird found worldwide in open country, parks, and gardens. It belongs to the family Passeridae, with many species recognized globally.
example: Every morning, I feed the little sparrows in my backyard garden by scattering some seeds on the ground.

definition: To use words to express thoughts or ideas, often aloud. It also refers to the ability to do so effectively and clearly.
example: She can speak three languages fluently. In school, the teacher asked if anyone could speak up about the homework assignment.

definition: A speaker is a device or system that produces sound, especially artificial speech. It can refer to various electronic devices such as loudspeakers, headphones, or microphones used for communication or audio playback.
example: "The conference room was equipped with a high-quality speaker system, ensuring clear and audible presentations."

definition: Having a particular, typically distinctive, character or purpose; not ordinary or commonplace.
example: "Her special talent was the ability to paint realistic portraits with just three colors."

definition: A specialist is an individual who has extensive knowledge, skills, or expertise in a specific area or field.
example: The cardiologist is a specialist who diagnoses and treats heart-related issues.

definition: To specialize or specialise is to concentrate on a particular aspect, branch, or type of work, job, study, etc., often in order to become very skilled at it.
example: She decided to specialize in marine biology because she loves the ocean and wants to learn more about its creatures.

definition: Used to refer to something that has been done or made for a particular purpose or person, or for an unusual or extraordinary reason.
example: I prepared a specially designed cake for my friend's birthday.

definition: A specialty refers to a specific branch of study, skill, or profession that requires advanced knowledge and expertise.
example: She has a specialty in pediatric neurosurgery and is renowned for her work with complex cases.

definition: A species is a group of living organisms that share common characteristics, can interbreed to produce fertile offspring, and form a distinct population with evolutionary potential.
example: The giant panda (Ailuropoda melanoleuca) is a unique species native to China known for its distinctive black-and-white coat. Despite superficial similarities, it cannot interbreed with other bear species like brown or polar bears.

definition: Specific refers to something that is exact, detailed, or clearly defined. It can be contrasted with general or vague.
example: The doctor prescribed a specific type of antibiotic for the infection.

definition: Specifically refers to something that is stated or made clear in detail, focusing on a particular point or aspect. It is used to emphasize exactness and precision.
example: "I need to focus specifically on the grammar mistakes in this essay."

definition: To identify or describe something in detail, particularly by naming particular examples or providing precise information.
example: In her email, the client specified that she needed a red sweater with a white polka dot pattern.

definition: A spectacle is an impressive or striking event or sight, often one that is public and dramatic. It can also refer to a pair of glasses or goggles worn for protective or decorative purposes.
example: The grand fireworks display over the city skyline was a beautiful spectacle that drew many spectators.

definition: Stunningly impressive or amazing, usually in a way that is grand or imposing.
example: "The sunset over the mountains was absolutely spectacular."

definition: A spectator is a person who observes or watches an event, especially one that involves sport or entertainment.
example: There were thousands of spectators at the football game.

definition: Speech is an oral expression of thoughts, ideas, or information in a structured and coherent manner using words. It involves both verbal and nonverbal communication.
example: "During the graduation ceremony, the valedictorian delivered an inspiring speech to the students about pursuing their dreams."

definition: Speed refers to the rate or pace at which something moves or occurs. It is usually measured in units such as miles per hour (mph) or kilometers per hour (km/h).
example: The car was driving at a speed of 60 miles per hour on the highway.

definition: A speeder is a vehicle, typically a car or motorcycle, that exceeds the legal speed limit.
example: "The police pulled over John for speeding on the highway; his speedometer had reached 90 miles per hour."

definition: A spell is a series of words that are spoken in a ritual or incantation, believed to have magical power. It can also refer to the act of reciting such words or phrases.
example: The witch cast a spell over her cauldron at midnight, mumbling ancient words of power.

definition: Being completely captivated, fascinated, or enchanted to such an extent that one is unable to move or speak.
example: The audience was spellbound as the magician performed his mysterious tricks on stage.

definition: Spelling is the practice of representing words in writing by using a sequence of letters or characters, according to conventional rules or conventions.
example: The spelling of "happy" is correct because it uses the letters 'h', 'a', 'p', 'p', 'y'.

definition: To use or consume money, time, effort, etc., in a particular way or on something. It often implies that resources are being depleted or used up.
example: John spends two hours every day at the gym to maintain his fitness level.

definition: A sphere is a three-dimensional geometric shape that is round and evenly curved all over. It is the set of points that are at a constant distance from a central point, called the center.
example: The Earth can be approximated as a sphere, with its center located in the middle.

definition: A spice is a substance derived from various parts of plants (such as bark, buds, roots, seeds, or fruits) used to flavor and preserve food.
